signals.title: Julio Garros Named Chief Operating Officer at Bunge Global SA
signals.summary: Julio Garros will become the Chief Operating Officer of Bunge Global SA on December 12, 2025, following David Mattiske's departure as co-COO. Mattiske will step down on December 11, 2025, and leave the company by the end of the year, assisting with the transition.

signals.title: Bunge Co-COO David Mattiske to Step Down
signals.summary: Bunge announced that co-COO David Mattiske will step down effective December 11, 2025, ceasing to be an executive officer. He will assist with an orderly transition following his departure.

signals.title: Vontobel Holding Ltd. Sells 14,136 Shares of Bunge Global SA
signals.summary: Vontobel Holding Ltd. sold 14,136 shares of Bunge Global SA on December 27, 2025. This institutional share sale occurs amid recent positive analyst updates, including Bank of America raising its price target to $112 with a buy rating.

signals.title: Benson Hill Acquires ZFS Creston LLC to Expand Soy Processing Capacity
signals.summary: Benson Hill, a St. Louis-based crop improvement company, announced the purchase of ZFS Creston LLC, a manufacturing operation in Iowa, to boost its ultra soy capacity. The acquisition was reported last week, enhancing Benson Hill's production capabilities in the soybean sector.

signals.title: ACME Solar Secures 130 MW Round-The-Clock Renewable Energy Project from REMC
signals.summary: ACME Solar Holdings Limited received a Letter of Award to develop a 130 MW Renewable Energy Round-the-Clock power project from REMC Limited at a fixed tariff of ₹4.35 per unit for 25 years. This project supports stable revenue and aligns with India's renewable energy goals. The announcement complies with SEBI regulations and confirms no conflicts of interest.

signals.title: ACME Solar Holdings Incorporates Wholly Owned Subsidiary ACME Greentech Nineteen Private Limited
signals.summary: ACME Solar Holdings established ACME Greentech Nineteen Private Limited on December 23, 2025, with ₹1 lakh initial investment for renewable energy project development and operations. Located in Gurugram, the subsidiary strengthens the company's expansion in power generation. It focuses on development, establishment, and operation of renewable projects.

signals.title: ACME Solar Bags Rs 47.2 Billion Financing for Clean Energy Projects
signals.summary: ACME Solar Holdings secured Rs 47.2 billion in debt financing from institutions including Power Finance Corporation, National Bank for Financing Infrastructure Development, and Yes Bank. Funds support 300 MW FDRE project, 150 MW solar-plus-storage project, and refinancing of 300 MW Sikar solar project. This lowers financing costs and advances construction of projects with grid connectivity.

signals.title: ADM Declares Cash Dividend of 51.0 Cents Per Share
signals.summary: ADM's Board of Directors declared a cash dividend of 51.0 cents per share, payable on December 11, 2025, to shareholders of record on November 19, 2025. This marks the company's 376th consecutive quarterly payment, extending its record of over 94 years of uninterrupted dividends.

signals.title: Archer Daniels Midland Lays Off 95 Workers at Memphis Facility
signals.summary: ADM filed a WARN notice on December 19, 2025, to lay off 95 workers at its Memphis facility, with the closure set for January 2026. The layoffs are linked to a new joint venture in Arkansas.

signals.title: Greenwood Capital Associates LLC Buys New Shares in Archer Daniels Midland
signals.summary: Greenwood Capital Associates LLC purchased new shares in ADM, as reported in recent filings. This institutional investment reflects ongoing interest amid ADM's FY 2025 EPS guidance of $3.250-3.500 and a recent quarterly dividend announcement.

signals.title: ADM and Planters Cotton Oil Mill Form Cottonseed Processing Joint Venture
signals.summary: ADM has partnered with Planters Cotton Oil Mill to create a joint venture for cottonseed processing, with ADM holding a 60% stake. Planters will contribute its Pine Bluff, Arkansas facility, while ADM will add its Memphis facility, discontinuing seed crushing there. The venture aims to enhance supply chain efficiency and is set to launch in Q1 2026.

signals.title: ADM to Close North Memphis Facility, Laying Off 95 Workers
signals.summary: ADM is closing its North Memphis cottonseed processing facility in January 2026 as part of a new joint venture with Planters Cotton Oil Mill in Arkansas. The closure impacts 95 employees, with a WARN notice filed on December 19. This move is tied to asset optimization strategy.

signals.title: AGCO Raises Long-Term Financial Targets and Provides 2025 Outlook at 2024 Analyst Meeting
signals.summary: AGCO announced raised long-term financial targets through 2029, including mid-cycle adjusted operating margins of 14%-15%, outgrowing the industry by 4%-5% annually, and precision ag net sales of $2.0 billion. For 2025, the company expects net sales of approximately $9.6 billion and adjusted operating margins of 7.0%-7.5%, despite softening demand and dealer inventory destocking. Updates include PTx data platform launch in 2025 and FarmerCore distribution model.

signals.title: AGCO Advances PTx Precision Agriculture Portfolio with New Products and Distribution Strategy
signals.summary: AGCO plans to innovate with 3-5 new PTx products annually, accelerate sprayer rollout, execute Connected Cloud strategy, and expand distribution via full-line technology dealers and OEM partnerships including Fendt, Massey Ferguson, and Valtra. The PTx data platform's first offering launches in 2025, with full rollout by 2027, supported by specialized retrofit dealers and FarmerCore model shifting to farm-based service.

signals.title: Integral AI Announces World’s First AGI-Capable Model
signals.summary: Tokyo-based startup Integral AI, founded by former Google AI engineers, announced on December 8, 2025, what it claims is the world’s first AGI-capable model, marking a departure from traditional scaling approaches. The announcement was covered by Business Wire and multiple tech outlets.

signals.title: Google Releases Gemini 3 Flash as Default Model Across Platforms
signals.summary: On December 17, 2025, Google released Gemini 3 Flash and made it the default model in the Gemini app and Google Search's AI mode. This move intensifies competition with OpenAI amid surging market share.

signals.title: Google Launches Reimagined Gemini Deep Research with Interactions API
signals.summary: Google upgraded Gemini Deep Research based on Gemini 3 Pro, adding developer embedding via the new Interactions API for agentic applications. The tool improves factuality for due diligence and research, coinciding with OpenAI's GPT-5.2 release.

signals.title: AI Industry Sees Over $100 Billion in Investments, Predicting More Funding and Acquisitions
signals.summary: Crunchbase reports over $100 billion invested in AI since ChatGPT's launch, with predictions of increased funding and nearly 30% of HumanX conference companies as acquisition targets next year.

signals.title: AGI Provides Bi-Weekly Status Report on Management Cease Trade Order
signals.summary: Ag Growth International Inc. issued its latest bi-weekly status report on December 26, 2025, confirming no material changes since the prior report regarding the delay in filing Q3 2025 financial statements. The Management Cease Trade Order (MCTO) was granted on November 14, 2025, by the Manitoba Securities Commission due to filing delays. The company anticipates completing the required filings soon but notes risks of further restrictions if not filed within 60 days.

signals.title: AGI Announces Q4 2025 Dividend
signals.summary: Ag Growth International Inc. declared a cash dividend of $0.15 per common share for Q4 2025, payable on January 12, 2026, to shareholders of record on December 31, 2025. This represents an annualized dividend rate of $0.60 per share and is eligible for Canadian income tax purposes. The announcement was made on December 17, 2025.

signals.title: AGRA Industries and Carbon Clean Partner to Accelerate Carbon Capture Adoption in Biofuels Industry
signals.summary: AGRA Industries has partnered with Carbon Clean via an MOU to integrate Carbon Clean's modular CaptureX technology into biofuel production, targeting CO2 capture during fermentation to lower carbon intensity and enable IRA tax credits like 45Z and 45Q. The collaboration leverages AGRA's 60+ years of engineering expertise and Carbon Clean's innovative solutions to provide a one-stop-shop for US biofuel producers. Executives from both companies highlighted the partnership's potential to reduce emissions and support the circular economy.

signals.title: AIB International Appoints Aaron K. Edwards as New CEO Effective December 1, 2025
signals.summary: AIB International has appointed Aaron K. Edwards as its new Chief Executive Officer, effective December 1, 2025, bringing nearly 30 years of experience in the food, beverage, and nutrition sectors. Edwards aims to accelerate value delivery, enhance food safety, regulatory compliance, and operational excellence for clients from startups to global brands. The appointment is praised by board members for positioning AIB to lead in a transforming global food supply chain.

signals.title: AIB International's Hanna Sharafi Discusses Pest Protection Strategies at IAFP 2025
signals.summary: Hanna Sharafi, senior manager of new product development at AIB International, addressed pest protection in food facilities at the IAFP 2025 conference on December 22, 2025. She emphasized that pests do not wait for inspections, highlighting the need for proactive measures in food safety. This discussion underscores AIB's ongoing expertise in industry best practices.

signals.title: AGI Announces Q4 2025 Dividend
signals.summary: Ag Growth International Inc. (AGI) declared a cash dividend of $0.15 per common share for Q4 2025, payable on January 12, 2026 to shareholders of record on December 31, 2025. This maintains AGI's annualized dividend rate at $0.60 per share and is an eligible dividend for Canadian income tax purposes.

signals.title: AGI Announces Closing of $85 Million Public Offering of Senior Subordinated Unsecured Debentures
signals.summary: AGI closed a public offering of $85 million in senior subordinated unsecured debentures bearing 7.50% interest, maturing June 30, 2030, listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange. Net proceeds will repay senior operating credit lines, available for redraw for general corporate purposes.

signals.title: AGI Announces Full Exercise of Over-Allotment Option in Public Offering of Debentures
signals.summary: Underwriters fully exercised the over-allotment option for an additional $12.75 million in debentures related to AGI's recent offering. Proceeds will support repayment of senior credit lines for general corporate use.

signals.title: AGI Provides Bi-Weekly Status Report on Management Cease Trade Order
signals.summary: AGI issued its latest bi-weekly update confirming no material changes since the prior report and ongoing compliance with alternative information guidelines under NP 12-203. The delay stems from late filing of Q3 2025 financial statements due November 14, 2025.

signals.title: AMETEK Increases Dividend and Announces Multiple Leadership Changes
signals.summary: AMETEK's board approved a 10% increase in its quarterly cash dividend to $0.22 per share, payable March 31 to shareholders of record as of March 10. The company appointed Dean Seavers as a new director effective February 24, Joseph Plante as VP and GM of Instrumentation & Specialty Controls division (previously at AMETEK Brookfield), and Sheraz Ahmed as VP and GM of MRO division, replacing retiring Brian Hoffmann.[1]

signals.title: AMETEK Brookfield Appoints Joseph Plante as VP and GM of Instrumentation & Specialty Controls
signals.summary: Joseph Plante, previously division vice president and business unit manager for AMETEK Brookfield, has been appointed vice president and general manager of AMETEK’s Instrumentation & Specialty Controls division. This leadership change is part of broader executive updates at AMETEK.[1]

signals.title: AMETEK Declares Quarterly Dividend of $0.31 per Share for Q4 2025
signals.summary: AMETEK declared a regular quarterly dividend of $0.31 per share for the fourth quarter ending December 31, 2025, payable December 19 to shareholders of record as of December 5. This reflects the company's strong financial position and commitment to shareholders.[2]

signals.title: AMETEK Brookfield Names Vicki Case as Global Marketing Director
signals.summary: AMETEK Brookfield appointed Vicki Case as Global Marketing Director. Vicki spent the past 12 years at Sealed Air Corporation in various marketing roles.[6]

signals.title: AMETEK Brookfield Shows Positive Credit Momentum with Spread Tightening
signals.summary: AMETEK Brookfield's credit momentum is positive, with a credit spread tightening of -0.313, indicating improving market sentiment as of December 18, 2025.[5]

signals.title: Argentina Cuts Grain Export Taxes, Welcomed by CIARA-CEC Grain Processors Chamber
signals.summary: The Argentine government announced reductions in export duties on grains including soybeans from 26.5% to 24%, corn and sorghum from 9.5% to 8.5%, and wheat and barley from 9.5% to 7.5%, effective upon publication in the Official Gazette. Gustavo Idigoras, president of CIARA-CEC—the chamber representing grain exporters and processors including APOSGRAN members—hailed the decision as highly valued by the agricultural sector, noting it restores profitability. The move supports President Milei's base in farming and agribusiness, though analysts predict limited immediate impact on domestic prices.

signals.title: Alapala to Expand Marata Group Capacity to 2,200 TPD
signals.summary: Alapala Holding Inc. is expanding the Marata Group's milling capacity to 2,200 tons per day following the successful operation of their existing 600 TPD facility. This project underscores Alapala's role in enhancing client production capabilities in the flour milling sector. The announcement highlights ongoing growth in their project portfolio.

signals.title: Alapala Secures Second Turnkey Flour Mill Contract with Jordan's Shams Grain
signals.summary: Alapala Holding has formalized its second turnkey flour mill agreement with Shams Grain in Jordan, doubling the company's production capacity to 300 TPD. This deal strengthens Alapala's presence in the Middle East milling market. Published on December 15, 2025.

signals.title: Alapala Secures Second Turnkey Flour Mill Contract with Jordan's Shams Grain
signals.summary: Alapala has secured its second turnkey flour mill contract with Jordan's Shams Grain company. This deal underscores Alapala's growing presence in the Jordanian market and its expertise in delivering complete milling solutions. The contract was announced around December 15-16, 2025.

signals.title: Alapala to Expand Marata Group Capacity to 2,200 TPD
signals.summary: Alapala will expand the Marata Group's flour milling capacity from 600 TPD to 2,200 TPD following the successful operation of their existing turnkey mill commissioned three years ago. CEO Görkem Alapala highlighted the strong performance and trust in their technology. The announcement was made on December 26, 2025.

signals.title: Alapala to Expand Marata Group Capacity to 2,200 TPD
signals.summary: Alapala will expand the Marata Group's milling capacity from 600 tons to 2,200 tons per day following the successful operation of the existing facility. This significant upgrade underscores Alapala's expertise in turnkey milling solutions. The project was announced on December 26, 2025.

signals.title: Alapala Secures Second Turnkey Flour Mill Contract with Jordan's Shams Grain
signals.summary: Alapala Holding has secured a contract to build a turnkey flour mill for Shams Grain in Jordan, doubling their production capacity to 300 TPD. This marks the second project with the client and highlights Alapala's growing presence in the Middle East. Published on December 15, 2025.

signals.title: Alapala Completes Tayyaba Flour Mills Project in Islamabad
signals.summary: Alapala has successfully completed and delivered its turnkey Tayyaba Flour Mills project in Islamabad, Pakistan. This project demonstrates Alapala's capability in delivering high-quality milling solutions in South Asia. Dated December 4, 2025.

signals.title: Alapala to Expand Marata Group Capacity to 2,200 TPD
signals.summary: Alapala announced a project to expand Marata Group's capacity to 2,200 tons per day using the latest technologies in grain, feed, pulses, and bakery processing. This development was reported on December 26, 2025, highlighting Alapala's role in major capacity upgrades. It underscores their expertise in turnkey feed and milling solutions.

signals.title: Alapala Sets New Industry Standards with 23 Turnkey Projects and US$129M Portfolio in 2024
signals.summary: Alapala completed 23 turnkey projects in 2024 with a portfolio valued at US$129 million, reflecting strong demand for their sustainable solutions. CEO Görkem Alapala highlighted their commitment to innovation and efficiency. The company introduced a groundbreaking three-year warranty on turnkey plants, setting new industry precedents.

signals.title: Machine Factory Reinartz Joins the KAHL Group Through Acquisition
signals.summary: Reinartz GmbH & Co. KG, a machine factory with over 170 years of expertise in separation processes, has been acquired by the KAHL Group, which includes Amandus Kahl GmbH & Co. KG. The move aims to leverage synergies in technology, purchasing, sales, and innovation, particularly in alternative proteins, biomass processing, and mechanical drying. Reinartz will operate independently, retaining its name, site, and jobs, while collaborating with KAHL Group companies like Amandus Kahl.

signals.title: New Management Team Appointed at Reinartz Following KAHL Group Acquisition
signals.summary: As part of its integration into the KAHL Group, Reinartz announces a new management team: Niklas Stadermann and Artur Kühl as managing directors, with Michael Moll stepping down but remaining as consultant and advisory board member. This change supports long-term innovation and market expansion. The leadership will drive strategic partnerships and new market entry alongside Amandus Kahl and other group entities.

signals.title: Amandus Kahl GmbH & Co. KG Files Patent Application for Flat Die Press
signals.summary: Amandus Kahl GmbH & Co. KG filed an international patent application (PCT/EP2025/063035) on May 13, 2025, for a 'Flat Die Press and Method for Processing a Material,' as announced on December 22, 2025. This filing highlights ongoing innovation in processing technology. The patent details were published recently in Geneva.

signals.title: Amandus Kahl to Showcase Dust-Free Pelleting Solutions and Plastic Waste Recycling at K 2025
signals.summary: Amandus Kahl will present innovative technologies at K 2025 in Düsseldorf for sustainable plastics processing, including dust-free dosing of polymer additives using flat die pellet mills like the 33-390 and 38-600 series. The company will also highlight solutions for recycling plastic waste with larger pellet mills such as the 39-1000 and 45-1250 to increase bulk density and prepare materials for chemical recycling.

signals.title: Amandus Kahl Files International Patent Application for Flat Die Press and Material Processing Method
signals.summary: On December 22, 2025, Amandus Kahl GmbH & Co. KG filed a patent application (PCT/EP2025/063035) published as WO/2025/256841 for a flat die press and method for processing materials. Inventors Rochus Mecke and Joachim Behrmann developed the technology under the International Patent Classification system managed by WIPO.

signals.title: K2 Ethanol Orders Ethanol and Animal-Feed Plants from ANDRITZ
signals.summary: K2 Ethanol Pvt. Ltd. has awarded ANDRITZ a major contract to design and construct integrated ethanol distillery (150,000 liters/day) and animal-feed pellet plant (400 tons/day) facilities in India, marking the country's first ethanol plant powered entirely by agro-residue. ANDRITZ holds full EPC responsibility, supporting India's renewable energy goals and sustainable agriculture. The contract is included in ANDRITZ’s Q3 2025 order intake.[1][2][5]

signals.title: Mowi enters into aquafeed partnership with Skretting
signals.summary: Mowi has partnered with Skretting to improve feed formulation, delivering more than NOK 650 million (EUR 55 million) in annualized net cost savings. Mowi will continue producing feed based on Skretting's formulations. The announcement was made on December 22, 2025.

signals.title: ADM Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
signals.summary: ADM announced third quarter 2025 earnings supported by strong business execution, portfolio optimization, and robust cash flow. The company revised its full-year 2025 guidance downward due to lower crush margins and biofuel demand environment. Year-to-date earnings before income taxes fell 51% to $779 million.[1]

signals.title: Archer Daniels Midland Lays Off 95 Workers at Memphis Facility
signals.summary: ADM filed a WARN notice on December 19, 2025, to lay off 95 workers at its Memphis facility, with closure set for January 2026. The layoffs are linked to a new joint venture restructuring. This impacts operations at the North Memphis site.[2][5]

signals.title: ADM Enters Cottonseed Oil Production via Joint Venture with Planters Cotton Oil Mill
signals.summary: ADM and Planters Cotton Oil Mill formed a joint venture for cottonseed processing, with ADM holding 60% stake. Planters contributes its Pine Bluff, Arkansas plant, while ADM adds its Memphis facility, discontinuing seed crushing there. The venture aims to enhance supply chain efficiency and launches in Q1 2026.[3]

signals.title: ADM Declares Cash Dividend of 51.0 Cents Per Share
signals.summary: ADM's Board declared a 51.0 cents per share cash dividend, payable December 11, 2025, to shareholders of record on November 19, 2025. This marks the company's 376th consecutive quarterly dividend payment over 94 years.[4]

signals.title: Ardent Mills Announces Closure of North Omaha Mill and Other Facilities
signals.summary: Ardent Mills will close its North Omaha (Nebraska) flour mill with 7,000 cwts daily capacity, a York, Pennsylvania mill, and a garbanzo bean plant in Steptoe, Washington, with operations winding down through 2025 and full closure by January 2026. The decisions stem from shifting market dynamics and competitive pressures, despite the Omaha North mill's 300+ years of history. The company plans to support affected employees with severance, transition services, and potential internal relocations while continuing investments in pulses.

signals.title: Arrowhead Mills Refreshes Brand with New Logo, Packaging, Website, and Two New Pancake Mixes
signals.summary: Arrowhead Mills debuted a redesigned logo, refreshed packaging, revamped website, and two new SKUs: Organic Oat Flour Pancake & Waffle Mix (Gluten Free) and Organic Apple Cider Pancake & Waffle Mix (Limited-Edition). The update celebrates the brand's 50th anniversary and highlights that over 87% of products are USDA Certified Organic, aiming to attract new consumers while retaining loyalists. COO Dan Anglemyer emphasized the brand's commitment to organic agriculture and innovation.

signals.title: Arrowhead Milling Sells Facility to Panhandle Milling
signals.summary: Arrowhead Milling sold its facility to Panhandle Milling, enabling the buyer to expand capabilities, product portfolio, and custom packaging solutions. This transaction represents a strategic divestiture for Arrowhead Mills, Inc. in the grain milling sector.

signals.title: BUA Foods Announces New Sugar Factory 80% Complete
signals.summary: BUA Foods, a subsidiary of BUA Group, reported that its new sugar factory is 80% complete as of December 16, 2025. This development aims to boost production capacity in the sugar industry. It represents significant progress in expanding manufacturing capabilities.

signals.title: BUA Group Disburses N30 Billion in Cash Awards to 510 Employees at 2025 Night of Excellence
signals.summary: BUA Group honored 510 employees with N30 billion in cash awards during its 2025 Night of Excellence and Long Service Awards. NGX Group Chairman Umaru Kwairanga commended the company's leadership and employee dedication, attributing its success to people rather than just resources. The event highlighted long-term staff loyalty and corporate culture.

signals.title: BW Flexible Systems Merges Italian Operations Following $3 Million Facility Refurbishment
signals.summary: BW Flexible Systems has merged its Italian operations by closing the Vicenza factory and consolidating teams at the renovated Mestrino manufacturing facility, which cost $3 million and includes new R&D center, training rooms, and sustainable upgrades. The move aims to streamline customer experience and foster innovation in packaging systems. Executives highlighted the facility's role in supporting growth and global partners.

signals.title: BW Packaging Launches Hayssen X850 Multi-Jaw Flow Wrapper
signals.summary: BW Packaging, which includes BW Flexible Systems, launched the Hayssen X850 flow wrapper on December 1, 2025, designed for high-speed sealing of cheese and similar products with up to 300 packs per minute. Features include patented ring technology, quick-release jaws, jam detection, and advanced HMI for easier operation and maintenance. The product builds on the legacy Hayssen RT model with customer feedback-driven improvements.

signals.title: BW Packaging Reorganizes by Integrating BW Flexible Systems and Other Divisions into Single Global Brand
signals.summary: BW Packaging announced a reorganization transitioning from three units—BW Flexible Systems, BW Filling & Closing, and BW Integrated Systems—into one product line-oriented structure to enhance collaboration, integrated solutions, and customer support worldwide. Existing contracts remain unaffected, with leadership emphasizing agility and forward-thinking services. The change unifies over 2,000 employees under the BW Packaging brand.

signals.title: Barilla Announces Winning Startups of Good Food Makers 2025 Program
signals.summary: Barilla has selected the winning startups for its Good Food Makers 2025 program, aimed at fostering food innovation. This initiative highlights Barilla's commitment to supporting emerging food technologies and sustainable practices. The announcement was made on December 10, 2025.

signals.title: Barilla Celebrates Italian Cuisine as UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage
signals.summary: Barilla marks the UNESCO recognition of Italian cuisine as an Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity, reaffirming its role as a global ambassador. The company participated in related events, including the UNCA Awards on December 12, 2025, in New York. This milestone aligns with Barilla's mission to promote Italian food values worldwide.

signals.title: Barilla Declares Pasta the Official Food of Cozy Season with Snowfall Pasta Return
signals.summary: Barilla brings back its limited-edition Snowfall Pasta and spotlights lasagne for the cozy season, available in the US and Canada from November through December. The campaign positions pasta as the ultimate comfort food amid dropping temperatures. Announced on December 10, 2025.

signals.title: Goat Holdco Issues $750 Million Senior Secured Notes Due 2032
signals.summary: On December 24, 2024, Goat Holdco, LLC, operating as Barnes, issued $750 million in 6.75% Senior Secured Notes due 2032 in a private transaction exempt from Securities Act registration. The notes support the ongoing merger process, with reports available to qualified investors under confidentiality agreements. A quarterly teleconference for noteholders is planned starting with the fiscal quarter ending March 31, 2025.

signals.title: Bartlett Project to Reduce Environmental Impact of Wheat Production
signals.summary: Bartlett has partnered with another company to provide no-cost cleaning services for local residents in need as part of a project aimed at reducing the environmental impact of wheat production. The initiative focuses on community support in the Coffeyville area. Published on December 19, 2025.

signals.title: POSCO International Partners with Bartlett to Boost Grain Business
signals.summary: POSCO International signed an agreement with Bartlett and Company to expand grain trading to 4 million tons annually by 2027. The partnership strengthens POSCO's sourcing and trading of U.S. grains like corn, wheat, and soybeans, leveraging Bartlett's strong domestic market presence. This supports POSCO's agribusiness expansion, handling 5.5 million tons in 2025.

signals.title: Bartlett & Co. Exits Feedlot Business and Merges with Savage
signals.summary: Bartlett & Co. announced its exit from the feedlot business through a merger with Savage. This strategic move refocuses operations amid December 2025 market conditions. Details on the merger terms and future operations were not specified in available reports.

signals.title: Bay State Milling Adds Montana Mill
signals.summary: Bay State Milling announced the addition of Bay State Milling Montana to its portfolio, assuming full ownership of the facility after years of partnering with Montana Gluten Free. The facility processes SowNaked Mindfully Farmed Oats, non-GMO hulless oats with higher protein, gluten-free certification, and 50% lower carbon emissions. This acquisition strengthens the company's food ingredients portfolio across 13 facilities in the U.S. and Canada.

signals.title: Behlen Mfg. Co. Acquires Sweet Manufacturing Co.
signals.summary: Behlen Mfg. Co. announced the acquisition of Sweet Manufacturing Co., a family-owned business with over 69 years of history, with closing expected by the end of January 2025. Both companies share aligned cultures and commitments to quality and customer service in the grain, feed, and industrial storage sectors. This marks Behlen's 14th acquisition since 1984.[1]

signals.title: Behlen Mfg Co Files Complaint Against Greene Builds Inc et al
signals.summary: On December 12, 2025, Behlen Mfg Co filed a complaint in the U.S. District Court for the Western District of Oklahoma against Nolan Greene, Greene Builds Inc, David Wilkerson, and Susan Wilkerson. The case, numbered 5:2025cv01496, involves unspecified claims leading to litigation.[3][4]

signals.title: Qualasole™ French Polish to Feature Mohawk and Behlen Logos via Special Order
signals.summary: Qualasole™ French Polish will soon be available by special order and production, branded with Mohawk and Behlen logos and product numbers. This update appears on a wood finish supply site in December 2025. It represents a new offering in their product line.

signals.title: Behlen Manufacturing Company Fined $59,996 for Hazardous Waste Violations
signals.summary: Behlen Manufacturing Company agreed to pay a $59,996 civil penalty to the EPA for hazardous waste violations at its facility in Columbus, Nebraska. The enforcement action addresses non-compliance with environmental regulations. Details confirm involvement of Behlen Manufacturing, part of Behlen Universal.

signals.title: Beta Technologies Makes Electric Debut in Paris and Announces MoU with Republic Airways
signals.summary: Beta Technologies signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Republic Airways to test its Alia CX300 electric aircraft, starting with CTOL version for crew training by year-end. The deal involves a significant number of aircraft for cargo, logistics, and passenger routes. Beta is also partnering with Bristow and Avinor for a regulatory sandbox operation in Norway to demonstrate commercial viability.

signals.title: Beta Technologies to Announce Third Quarter 2025 Results on December 4, 2025
signals.summary: Beta Technologies will release its Q3 2025 financial results before market open on December 4, 2025, followed by a conference call at 8:30 a.m. ET. The company designs and manufactures electric aircraft including ALIA CTOL and VTOL models, with over 83,000 nautical miles flown and a growing charging network.

signals.title: Beta Technologies Advances Pilot Training Programs for Electric Aircraft
signals.summary: Beta Technologies conducted its first customer review of the full-syllabus pilot training program for eCTOL aircraft with United Therapeutics, ahead of 2025 deliveries. The company received FAA authorization for test pilots to train additional personnel in eVTOL aircraft, advancing certification efforts. Beta is developing an eVTOL simulator to meet FAA training requirements.

signals.title: Bob's Red Mill Unveils New Overnight Protein Oats at Natural Products Expo West 2025
signals.summary: Bob’s Red Mill launched Overnight Protein Oats in Blueberries & Cream and Vanilla Almond flavors, featuring 10g of protein with 8g sugar or less using a hull-less oat variety that produces 48% fewer carbon emissions. The product debuts at Natural Products Expo West, March 4-7, 2025, alongside reformulated Instant Oatmeal Packets in nostalgic flavors like Classic and Apple & Cinnamon. Both are Certified Gluten-Free, Non-GMO Project Verified, and will be available nationwide this spring.

signals.title: Explosión en bodega clandestina de pirotecnia en Santa María Jalapa del Marqués, Oaxaca, deja dos muertos
signals.summary: Una bodega clandestina de pirotecnia almacenada en una tienda de abarrotes explotó debido a una chispa de soldadura, causando la muerte de Fernando Tapia, de 50 años, y su hijo. Los vecinos intentaron apagar el fuego con cubetas de agua, pero detonaciones secundarias los obligaron a evacuar; el incendio duró más de dos horas y expuso la falta de bomberos y personal de Protección Civil en el municipio. Apoyo llegó de la Marina, bomberos de Salina Cruz y habitantes locales.[1][2]

signals.title: STIF Group Finalizes Acquisition of 80% Stake in Boss Products, LLC
signals.summary: STIF Group completed its acquisition of 80% of Boss Products, LLC on September 26, 2025, increasing its stake from 10% held since early 2024. The deal, financed by bank debt, integrates Boss Products' $17.7 million 2024 revenue and U.S. distribution network, projecting STIF's pro forma revenue at €100 million by end of 2025. Management remains in place to drive North American commercial activities amid growth in industrial safety markets.

signals.title: Boss Products Officially Joins STIF Group as Next Growth Chapter
signals.summary: Boss Products joined the STIF Group effective September 26, 2025, enhancing resources for product development, technology, and customer support. The move expands international reach and ensures long-term stability while maintaining commitment to quality and safety. This follows STIF's prior 10% stake and exclusive partnership since 2017.

signals.title: Gorilla Technology's Legal Victory Over Sigma and Bradbury Restores Shareholder Value
signals.summary: Gorilla Technology (NASDAQ: GRRR) announced the successful resolution of its lawsuit filed on December 8, 2025, against Sigma Global Fund SPC, its affiliates, and Bradbury. This legal victory is reported to restore shareholder value for Gorilla Technology. The case appears to involve Bradbury Co., Inc. or affiliates in a regulatory dispute.

signals.title: The Bradbury Group's End of Year Economic Outlook: A Pessimistic Perspective
signals.summary: The Bradbury Group released its end-of-year economic outlook for 2025, describing New Zealand's economy as resilient against global shocks but adopting an overall pessimistic perspective. This outlook highlights challenges amid geopolitical tensions and financial pressures. It reflects Bradbury's view on industry developments affecting their operations.

signals.title: The Cultured Hub Expands into Plant Cell Culturing Capabilities
signals.summary: The Cultured Hub, a joint venture between Bühler, Migros, and Givaudan, has expanded its services to include plant cell culturing for sustainable ingredient production. This supports alternative proteins amid rising commodity prices and climate challenges. Bühler CTO Ian Roberts highlighted its potential as a new frontier in food innovation.

signals.title: Pow.Bio and Bühler Join Forces to Advance Next-Generation Precision Fermentation
signals.summary: Pow.Bio and Bühler Group announced a collaboration on December 9, 2025, to develop an integrated continuous precision fermentation platform. The partnership aims to accelerate biomanufacturing, reduce production costs, and improve performance. They are now onboarding customers for commercialization.

signals.title: Bühler Acquires Cutting-Edge Puffing Technology from CEREX
signals.summary: Bühler has acquired innovative puffing technology from CEREX for applications in food, pet food, and feed. This enhances Bühler's offerings in processing technologies. The acquisition strengthens their position in these markets.

signals.title: Bühler Southern Africa Closes 2025 Strong on Innovation and Local Investment
signals.summary: Despite global volatility and supply chain issues, Bühler Southern Africa ended 2025 with solid momentum through innovation and local investments. The company demonstrated resilience amid shifting consumer behavior.

signals.title: Bühler CTO Calls for New Era in Milling and Food Innovation at IAOM MEA 2025
signals.summary: At IAOM MEA 2025 in Jeddah, Bühler CTO Dr. Ian Roberts emphasized protein diversification, AI, and industrial-scale upcycling as key drivers for milling and food innovation.

signals.title: Bühler Industries Announces Going Private Agreement with ASKO
signals.summary: Bühler Industries, manufacturer of Versatile and Farm King equipment, has entered an amalgamation agreement with majority shareholder ASKO and its subsidiary Newco to take the company private. The move aims to enable faster decisions for heavy investments in factory modernization and new product development, including a soon-to-be-launched Versatile tractor, without altering sales or marketing strategies. Investments focus on North American production capabilities with new tooling like laser cutting and welding robots.

signals.title: Pow.Bio and Bühler Join Forces to Advance Next-Generation Precision Fermentation
signals.summary: Pow.Bio and Bühler announced a partnership on December 9, 2025, to advance precision fermentation technologies. The collaboration combines expertise from Alameda, US, and Uzwil, Switzerland, to drive innovations in this field.

signals.title: The Cultured Hub Expands into Plant Cell Culturing Capabilities
signals.summary: The Cultured Hub, a joint venture of Bühler, Migros, and Givaudan, expanded services on December 24, 2025, to include plant cell culturing for sustainable ingredient production. This addresses challenges like scaling bioprocesses amid rising commodity prices and climate pressures, with Bühler’s CTO highlighting its potential as a new frontier in food production.

signals.title: Change in Executive Management at Bühler Technologies as of December 31, 2025
signals.summary: Bühler Technologies GmbH announced a change in its Executive Management effective December 31, 2025. Further details on the specific changes were not provided in the announcement.

signals.title: The Cultured Hub Announces Expansion with Plant Cell Culturing Services
signals.summary: On December 17, 2025, The Cultured Hub, involving Bühler, announced an expansion of its offerings to include plant cell culturing capabilities. This supports scaling in alternative ingredient production through advanced bioprocess equipment and collaboration.

signals.title: Bunge Closes $34B Merger with Glencore-Backed Viterra
signals.summary: Bunge Global has completed its $34 billion merger with Glencore-backed Viterra, creating a major global crop trading and processing company to compete with ADM and Cargill. The deal enhances Bunge’s grain export and oilseed processing in the U.S., Canada, and Australia. Greg Heckman and John Neppl retain their CEO and CFO roles, with David Mattiske and Julio Garros as co-COOs.

signals.title: Bunge Global SA Announces Executive Changes
signals.summary: David Mattiske is stepping down as co-Chief Operating Officer of Bunge Global SA effective December 31, 2025, to pursue other opportunities. He will assist with transition until then. Julio Garros, the current co-COO, will assume the sole COO position effective December 12, 2025.

signals.title: Bunge Canada Accelerates Vegetable Oil Processing Plant Expansion in Saskatchewan
signals.summary: Bunge Canada, a division of Bunge North America, has advanced into high gear on expanding its vegetable oil processing plant in Saskatchewan. This project supports enhanced processing capabilities.

signals.title: Bunting® Magnetics Co. expands global operations with acquisition of UK-based Master Magnets Ltd
signals.summary: Bunting Magnetics Co. has signed an agreement to acquire Master Magnets Ltd, a UK-based manufacturer of magnetic separation equipment, to broaden customer reach, manufacturing capabilities, and market access. The acquisition complements Bunting's innovation and quality in magnetic solutions, particularly in mining, quarrying, and aggregate sectors. Executives from both companies expressed excitement about combining nearly 100 years of experience.

signals.title: Bunting Magnetics Unveils High Temperature FF Drawer Magnet
signals.summary: Bunting Magnetics introduced a High Temperature FF Drawer Magnet engineered for industrial environments with hazards like debris, chips, and airborne particles. The product is designed to handle high-temperature conditions effectively.

signals.title: The Cultured Hub Expands into Plant Cell Culturing Capabilities
signals.summary: The Cultured Hub, a joint venture between Bühler, Migros, and Givaudan, has expanded its services to include plant cell culturing for sustainable ingredient production like cocoa, coffee, and citrus. This addresses supply chain pressures from climate volatility and commodity prices. Bühler CTO Ian Roberts highlighted its potential as a new frontier in sustainable food production.

signals.title: ASKO Successfully Acquires Full Ownership of Bühler Industries Inc.
signals.summary: ASKO has fully acquired all shares of Bühler Industries, including Versatile and Farm King brands, following earlier amalgamation. This move enables prompt investments in factory modernization and new product development without stock exchange constraints. No changes to sales and marketing strategy are planned.

signals.title: Bühler Industries Announces Going Private Agreement
signals.summary: Bühler Industries, manufacturer of Versatile and Farm King equipment, announced an amalgamation agreement with ASKO, its majority shareholder, and a wholly-owned subsidiary to take the company private. The move enables prompt decisions for heavy investments in factory modernization and new product development without stock exchange constraints. Investments focus on North American production, including new tooling like laser cutting and welding robots, with a new Versatile product launch planned soon.

signals.title: Bühler Names Two Fellows for Advancing Sustainability and Technological Innovation
signals.summary: Bühler named Béatrice Conde and another individual as Fellows on December 1, 2025, recognizing their contributions to sustainability and technological innovation. This recognition highlights the company's commitment to these areas amid ongoing advancements.

signals.title: The Cultured Hub Expands into Plant Cell Culture for Cocoa, Coffee, and Citrus
signals.summary: Bühler Group's The Cultured Hub, established with Migros and Givaudan, has expanded its services to include plant cell culture technology for sustainable production of coffee, cocoa, and citrus ingredients. This move addresses climate challenges and rising commodity prices by supporting innovators in scaling climate-resilient food ingredients. CTO Ian Roberts highlighted the hub's role in overcoming scaling bottlenecks for industrial application.

signals.title: Bühler Appoints Mike Häfeli as New CEO of Grains & Food Division
signals.summary: Bühler has appointed Mike Häfeli as the new CEO of its Grains & Food division, effective after Johannes Wick steps down at the end of 2025 following a decade of leadership. Wick will transition to a new role within the company. This leadership update aims to continue strong performance in the sector.

signals.title: Bühler Southern Africa Closes 2025 with Strong Momentum on Innovation and Local Investment
signals.summary: Despite global volatility, supply chain disruptions, and shifting consumer behavior, Bühler Southern Africa concludes 2025 positively through focus on innovation and local investments. The company demonstrates resilience and solid performance amid challenging market conditions.

signals.title: C.H. Guenther & Son LLC Recalls 365 Whole Foods Market Small Bites Macaroni & Cheese Due to Undeclared Egg and Meat
signals.summary: C.H. Guenther & Son LLC initiated a voluntary recall of its 8.5 oz 365 Whole Foods Market Small Bites Macaroni & Cheese sold nationwide between February 6 and March 11, 2025, due to undeclared egg and meat ingredients posing a risk of serious allergic reactions. The recall was prompted by a consumer complaint; no illnesses have been reported, and the issue has been corrected with preventative measures implemented. Affected products have UPC 99482499709 and best-by date of November 29, 2025.

signals.title: Brabender GmbH Acquired by Anton Paar, Affecting U.S. Operations as C.W. Brabender
signals.summary: Metrology company Anton Paar has acquired Brabender GmbH, known in the U.S. as C.W. Brabender Instruments, with the effective date retroactive to January 1, 2023. The acquisition integrates Brabender into Anton Paar as Anton Paar TorqueTec GmbH, strengthening material characterization offerings and committing to expand sites in Germany and Hackensack, N.J. Company leaders highlight benefits for R&D, sales, service, employees, and customers.

signals.title: Anton Paar Opens New U.S. Lab Showcasing Brabender Instruments
signals.summary: Anton Paar has unveiled a new laboratory in the U.S. exclusively for Brabender instruments, serving as a hub for application development. This facility highlights the integration of Brabender's technology post-acquisition. It supports advancements in testing and measurement for industries like food, plastics, and more.

signals.title: Chopin Technologies Joins KPM Analytics Group
signals.summary: Chopin Technologies, a world leader in grain quality control equipment, has merged with KPM Analytics, positioning the group as a major global supplier of solutions for cereal processing and food safety. The organization remains unchanged under Chairman and CEO Marc Doligé, who is committed to continued success and expansion. This acquisition enhances offerings for grain and flour production markets.[1]

signals.title: CHS Inc Reports Fiscal Year 2025 Net Income of $597.9 Million
signals.summary: CHS Inc announced a net income of $597.9 million for fiscal year 2025, marking a 10% decrease from the prior year. Consolidated revenues were $35.5 billion, down from $39.3 billion. The announcement was made on December 5, 2025.

signals.title: CHS Inc Reports $232 Million in Q3 2025 Net Income
signals.summary: For the third quarter of fiscal 2025, CHS Inc reported net income of $232 million. Over the first nine months, net income reached $401.2 million on revenues of $26.9 billion, compared to $990.5 million previously.

signals.title: CHS Launches 'It Takes a Co-op™' Podcast in 2025
signals.summary: CHS launched the 'It Takes a Co-op™' podcast in 2025, featuring interviews on agricultural, energy, and transportation topics. Highlighted episodes cover global grain supply chains, fertilizer planning, and ag volatility management.

signals.title: CHS INC PFD CL B SER 4 Announces Ex-Dividend Date of December 16, 2025
signals.summary: CHS Inc's preferred stock Class B Series 4 will go ex-dividend on December 16, 2025, with a dividend of $0.46875 per share payable on December 31 to shareholders of record.

signals.title: 2025 CHS Annual Meeting Highlights and Leadership Reports
signals.summary: The 2025 CHS Annual Meeting on December 4-5 featured reports from Board Chair Dan Schurr, CFO Olivia Nelligan, and CEO Jay Debertin. Election results, policy focuses, and the annual report are now available online.

signals.title: SEC Approves Registration of CME Securities Clearing Inc. (CMESC)
signals.summary: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has approved the registration of CME Group's new securities clearing house, CME Securities Clearing Inc. The launch is expected in Q2 2026 to help market participants comply with upcoming SEC Treasury and Repo clearing mandates. This marks a significant regulatory milestone for CME Group.

signals.title: FanDuel and CME Group Launch FanDuel Predicts Prediction Markets Platform
signals.summary: FanDuel and CME Group launched FanDuel Predicts in five U.S. states, with phased expansion through early 2026. The platform provides access to financial and sports prediction markets for millions of users. CME Group aims to expand its products to FanDuel's registered users nationwide.

signals.title: CME Group Inc. Announces Q4 and Year-End 2025 Earnings Release Date
signals.summary: CME Group will announce its fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 earnings on February 4, 2026, before markets open. Written highlights will be posted at 6:00 a.m. CT, followed by an investor conference call at 7:30 a.m. CT.

signals.title: December 2025 Rates Recap Highlights Record Volumes and Growth
signals.summary: CME Group's December Rates Recap reports record open interest in Treasuries exceeding 26M and 10-Year futures surpassing 6M OI. Credit futures achieved record ADV and ADOI, up over 150% from Q4 2024, with the first BTIC trade completed.

signals.title: CME Group Declares Quarterly Dividend of $1.25 Per Share
signals.summary: CME Group announced a quarterly dividend of $1.25 per share, payable on December 30, 2025, to stockholders of record on December 12. This represents an annualized dividend of $5.00 and a yield of 1.8%.

signals.title: Cummins Inc. Declares Quarterly Common Stock Dividend of $2.00 per Share
signals.summary: Cummins Inc. announced a quarterly common stock cash dividend of $2.00 per share, payable on December 4, 2025, to shareholders of record on November 21, 2025. This follows the company's Q3 earnings beat and reflects ongoing commitment to shareholder returns amid solid financial performance.

signals.title: Vontobel Holding Ltd. Cuts Holdings in Cummins Inc. (CMI) by 5.1%
signals.summary: Vontobel Holding Ltd. reduced its position in Cummins Inc. shares by 5.1% during the third quarter, as disclosed in a recent SEC filing dated December 25, 2025. This move comes alongside reports of Cummins beating Q3 EPS expectations and declaring a dividend.

signals.title: Exchange Traded Concepts LLC Increases Cummins Inc. (CMI) Holdings by 71.4%
signals.summary: Exchange Traded Concepts LLC boosted its holdings in Cummins Inc. by 71.4% in the third quarter, according to a filing on December 25, 2025. The increase occurs as Cummins reports strong Q3 fundamentals including EPS beat and a recent dividend declaration.

signals.title: Chair and CEO Jennifer Rumsey Sells 2,880 Shares of Cummins Inc. (CMI)
signals.summary: Jennifer Rumsey, Chair and CEO of Cummins Inc., sold 2,880 shares on November 11, 2025, for approximately $1,363,879. This insider sale is part of broader activity where insiders sold 27,330 shares worth $12.65 million in the past quarter.

signals.title: CPKC Holiday Train Raises Record $2 Million and Collects 175,000 Pounds of Food in 2025
signals.summary: Canadian Pacific Kansas City (CPKC) announced that its 2025 Holiday Train raised over $2 million and more than 175,000 pounds of food for local food banks across Canada, the US, and Mexico through 194 live shows. This brings the program's cumulative totals since 1999 to $28.3 million raised and 5.6 million pounds of food collected. CEO Keith Creel praised the community generosity and support.

signals.title: CPKC Holiday Train Raises Over $2 Million and Collects 175,000 Pounds of Food
signals.summary: Canadian Pacific Kansas City announced that its 2025 Holiday Train raised more than $2 million and collected over 175,000 pounds of food for local food banks during its multi-community tour on December 23, 2025. This initiative supports communities across its network.

signals.title: CPKC Responds to Union Pacific-Norfolk Southern Merger Application
signals.summary: CPKC stated it has received the Union Pacific-Norfolk Southern merger application filed with the Surface Transportation Board on December 19, 2025, and will review it for compliance with STB Major Merger Rules and consistency with the public interest. The company plans to assess the filing over the coming days.

signals.title: Keith Creel and Ian Gray to Speak at 2025 UBS Global Industrials Conference
signals.summary: CPKC President & CEO Keith Creel and SVP Ian Gray are scheduled to speak at the 2025 UBS Global Industrials and Transportation Conference on December 2, 2025, at 9:40 a.m. ET. This event provides insights into the company's operations and strategy.

signals.title: CPM Acquires Pellet Mill Part Supplier Jacobs Global
signals.summary: CPM, a provider of process equipment and aftermarket parts, has acquired Jacobs Global, a supplier of aftermarket parts for hammermills and pellet mills. This strategic acquisition enhances CPM's product offerings, expands market reach, and adds capacity to serve its global customer base. CEO David Webster highlighted the complementary expertise and commitment to customer service.

signals.title: Cardinal Scale Acquires Belt-Way Scales
signals.summary: Cardinal Scale Manufacturing has acquired Belt-Way Scales, a leading conveyor belt scale manufacturer based in Rock Falls, IL, since 1992. The acquisition expands Cardinal's product offerings in weighing systems and maintains Belt-Way's operations and employees in place. Cardinal Scale President Matthew Stovern highlighted the strategic fit and commitment to high-quality products.

signals.title: Cardinal Scale Hires New NE Regional Sales Manager
signals.summary: Cardinal Scale Manufacturing announced the appointment of a new Northeast Regional Sales Manager on December 17, 2025. This executive change aims to strengthen regional sales efforts. Details on the appointee were noted in the company's employee highlights.

signals.title: Tim Broemmer Appointed as Director of Business Development
signals.summary: Cardinal/Detecto Scale appointed Tim Broemmer as Director of Business Development to support ongoing company growth. This leadership update enhances the team's business development capabilities. The announcement underscores continued expansion efforts.

signals.title: Cardinal Scale Releases New 825 Gen2 Weight Indicator
signals.summary: Cardinal Scale launched the 825 Gen2, a programmable indicator/controller featuring a full-color graphics touchscreen available in three enclosure types. This new offering targets aggregate and quarry applications. It enhances precision in weighing operations.

signals.title: Cardinal Scale Releases New Single-Animal Livestock Scales
signals.summary: Cardinal Scale introduced new single-animal livestock scales, addressing needs in the agricultural sector. The release was highlighted in early December 2025 news affecting dairy producers. These scales support efficient livestock weighing.

signals.title: DETECTO Scale Models Offer EMR Connectivity with Schiller DS20
signals.summary: DETECTO, part of Cardinal Scale, enabled EMR connectivity for its apex® and solo® physician scales with Schiller's DS20 system. This integration improves data assimilation in healthcare settings. It enhances compatibility for medical weighing applications.

signals.title: Clinical Study Validates HealthySole HSPLUS Effectiveness
signals.summary: A University of Houston study proved the HealthySole HSPLUS from DETECTO reduces shoe sole pathogens by over 99%, lowering risks of hospital-acquired infections. The no-touch, 8-second decontamination aids infection control in sensitive areas. This press release highlights its role in safer environments.

signals.title: Cardinal Scale Acquires Belt-Way Scales
signals.summary: Cardinal Scale Manufacturing Co. has acquired Belt-Way Scales, a leading conveyor belt scale manufacturer based in Rock Falls, IL, since 1992. The acquisition expands Cardinal's product line in weighing systems and maintains Belt-Way's operations and employees in place. President Matthew Stovern highlighted it fills a strategic gap and complements their offerings.

signals.title: Tim Broemmer Appointed as Director of Business Development
signals.summary: Cardinal/Detecto Scale appointed Tim Broemmer, with over 12 years in heavy-capacity weighing and sales, as Director of Business Development. He will lead sales strategy, regional management, product development, and dealer growth in domestic industrial and agricultural markets. Broemmer holds a degree from Northwest Missouri State University.

signals.title: Cardinal Scale Hires Gary Renkenberger as Northeast US Regional Sales Manager
signals.summary: Cardinal Scale Manufacturing appointed Gary Renkenberger as Northeast US Regional Sales Manager to strengthen regional sales efforts. This hire supports the company's expansion in key markets.

signals.title: Cardinal Scale Releases New Single-Animal Livestock Scales
signals.summary: Cardinal Scale launched new single-animal livestock scales, enhancing their agricultural weighing solutions. This product targets efficiency in livestock management.

signals.title: DETECTO Scale Models Offer EMR Connectivity with Schiller DS20
signals.summary: DETECTO, part of Cardinal Scale, integrated its popular solo® and apex® physician scales with Schiller’s DS20 diagnostic station for direct EMR transmission of height, weight, BMI, and vital signs. The plug-and-play connectivity streamlines clinical workflows and patient data capture. VP Jonathan Sabo emphasized its role in advancing clinical measurement technology.

signals.title: Cardinal Scale Introduces IP69K-Rated Washdown Bench Scale
signals.summary: Cardinal Scale released an IP69K-rated washdown bench scale designed for durable, hygienic environments. The product supports applications requiring high washdown resistance.

signals.title: Cardinal Scale Implements Robotic Welding for Truck Scales
signals.summary: Cardinal/Detecto Scale adopted robotic welding systems to enhance precision and efficiency in manufacturing truck scale decks. This technology ensures customized, industrial-strength scales built to last.

signals.title: Cargill's Revenue Hits 4-Year Low Amid Falling Crop Prices
signals.summary: Cargill reported fiscal 2025 revenue of $154 billion, down from $160 billion in fiscal 2024 and the lowest since 2021, due to declining crop prices and a shrinking U.S. cattle herd. The company has restructured by reducing business units and cutting 8,000 jobs. It also sold its Malaysian animal feed unit and offered to acquire a Brazilian feed producer.

signals.title: Cargill Investing $475 Million in U.S. Soy Processing Operations
signals.summary: Cargill is investing $475 million to modernize and expand soy crush facilities across seven U.S. states, boosting capacity by 10% at one site and doubling it at another. The upgrades aim to improve efficiencies, logistics, and meet growing demand for soy in food and fuel markets. This supports farmers and customers amid rising global needs.

signals.title: Cargill Officially Opens New Employee Housing in Fort Morgan
signals.summary: Cargill opened new employee housing in Fort Morgan on December 4, 2025, to strengthen workforce support and continue investments in U.S. beef operations. This initiative enhances employee retention amid industry challenges.

signals.title: Cargill Deploys CarVe Technology at Fort Morgan Beef Plant
signals.summary: Cargill invested $24 million in a computer vision system called CarVe at its Fort Morgan plant to improve beef yield amid low U.S. cattle supplies. The tech monitors worker pace, knife sharpness, and behavior to enhance safety, efficiency, and output, potentially adding millions of pounds of beef.

signals.title: Cargill Transforms Brazil Agricultural Payments with Pix via J.P. Morgan
signals.summary: On December 15, 2025, Cargill implemented real-time Pix payments in Brazil with J.P. Morgan, enabling instant settlements to soybean farmers. This boosts financial stability, supply chain efficiency, and Cargill's credibility in a competitive market.

signals.title: Cargill Prepares for EUDR Compliance by December 30, 2025
signals.summary: Cargill is advancing a two-phase project to ensure compliance with the EU Deforestation Regulation (EUDR) for commodities like cocoa, palm oil, and soy. Dedicated teams are implementing risk assessments and due diligence systems to meet requirements and support customers.

signals.title: Cargill to Lay Off 80 Minnesota Workers Amid Farm Slump
signals.summary: Cargill plans to lay off about 80 employees in Minnesota, including at its Wayzata Office Center, starting December 31, due to a farm sector slump.

signals.title: Cargill Officially Opens New Employee Housing in Fort Morgan
signals.summary: Cargill has opened new employee housing in Fort Morgan to strengthen workforce support and continue investment in U.S. beef production. This initiative demonstrates the company's commitment to its employees and ongoing operations in the beef sector. The opening occurred on December 4, 2025.

signals.title: Cargill's Revenue Hits 4-Year Low Amid Falling Crop Prices
signals.summary: Cargill reported fiscal 2025 revenue of $154 billion, down from $160 billion in fiscal 2024 and the lowest since 2021, due to declining crop prices and a shrinking cattle herd. The company is restructuring by reducing business units and cutting 8,000 jobs. CEO Brian Sikes highlighted strategic decisions for growth amid industry challenges.

signals.title: Cargill Plans $17.5M Expansion Project at Linden Grain Facility
signals.summary: Cargill is seeking a 10-year tax abatement for a $17.5 million expansion at its Linden grain marketing facility, including new office space, grain bins, and conveyor systems. The project aims to increase capacity by 10 million bushels annually and address truck traffic backups. Completion is expected by July 2029.

signals.title: Carter's to Close 150 Stores Amid Tariff Pressures
signals.summary: Atlanta-based Carter’s announced it will shutter 150 stores nationwide over the next three years due to elevated product costs from tariffs and declining profitability, with Q3 net income dropping 80% to $11.6 million. The company plans $10 million in annual spending reductions and elimination of 300 office-based roles by end of 2025, representing a 15% workforce cut. CEO Douglas C. Palladini highlighted ongoing improvements in sales but noted impacts from tariffs and investments.

signals.title: Carter's (NYSE:CRI) Share Price Crosses Above 200-Day Moving Average
signals.summary: Carter's stock rose above its 200-day moving average of $30.05, reaching $31.94 and closing at $32.78 on increased volume, signaling positive momentum. This follows Q3 earnings of $0.74 EPS and $757.84 million revenue, slightly missing estimates, alongside a recent quarterly dividend of $0.25 per share yielding 3.1%. The company maintains strong fundamentals with 16.71% return on equity.

signals.title: MAAG Acquires Carter Day's Centrifugal Pellet Dryer Technology
signals.summary: MAAG has acquired Carter Day's centrifugal pellet dryer technology, integrating it into its product portfolio for the global petrochemical industry. This move enhances MAAG's offerings in plastics processing equipment. No further financial or timeline details were provided in the announcement.

signals.title: Carter's Plans to Close 150 Stores and Lay Off 15% of Workers
signals.summary: Carter's will close 150 stores as leases expire and implement workforce reductions, targeting $35 million in annual savings through 2026 measures amid tariff impacts. This follows significant profitability declines reported earlier. The actions aim to streamline operations in response to economic pressures.

signals.title: MAAG Group Acquires Carter Day International's Centrifugal Pellet Dryer Technology
signals.summary: MAAG Group announced the acquisition of certain assets from Carter Day International, Inc.'s petrochemical division on December 20, 2024, focusing on centrifugal pellet dryer technology for dewatering and drying in the plastics industry. The technology will integrate into MAAG's product portfolio, enhancing high-capacity solutions for pelletizing systems. This deal positions the dryer as a key asset in the petrochemical field.

signals.title: Dover Corporation Acquires Select Assets from Carter Day International's Petrochemical Division
signals.summary: Dover Corporation (NYSE: DOV) has acquired select assets from Carter Day International's petrochemical division, specializing in dryer manufacturing technology. The acquisition supports global petrochemical industry applications. Reports confirm Dover as the acquiring entity for these assets.

signals.title: MAAG Group Acquires Carter Day's Centrifugal Pellet Dryer Technology
signals.summary: MAAG Group announced the acquisition of certain assets from Carter Day International, Inc., specifically the centrifugal pellet dryer technology for the petrochemical division, on December 20, 2024. This technology will be integrated into MAAG's product portfolio to strengthen its offerings in the global petrochemical industry. The deal positions MAAG to expand its drying solutions for plastics processing.

signals.title: Dover Acquires Select Assets from Carter Day International's Petrochemical Division
signals.summary: Dover (NYSE: DOV) has acquired select assets from Carter Day International's petrochemical division, focusing on dryer manufacturer technology. This acquisition enhances Dover's capabilities in the global petrochemical market. Details on the specific assets and financial terms were not disclosed in the announcement.

signals.title: Central Life Sciences Adds Kylie Sherrill to Technical Services Team
signals.summary: Central Life Sciences has welcomed Kylie Sherrill to its technical services team, supporting the livestock feed additive and farm and ranch divisions. This addition strengthens the company's technical expertise in these areas.

signals.title: CERATIZIT USA Agrees to Pay $54.4M to Settle False Claims Act Allegations on Evaded Customs Duties
signals.summary: Ceratizit USA LLC settled with the U.S. Department of Justice for $54.4 million over allegations of evading Section 301 tariffs by transshipping Chinese tungsten carbide products through Taiwan and misclassifying them. The settlement, announced December 18, 2025, resolves claims of false country-of-origin declarations and improper tariff codes; a whistleblower receives about $9.75 million. DOJ reserves the right to pursue criminal charges.

signals.title: CERATIZIT Acquires Majority Stake in Best Carbide Cutting Tools
signals.summary: CERATIZIT's U.S. subsidiary acquired a majority stake in Best Carbide Cutting Tools, a California-based manufacturer of solid carbide round tools, for an undisclosed amount. The deal strengthens CERATIZIT's U.S. network and access to high-end micro tools, following their recent acquisition of Becker Diamantwerkzeuge. Executives highlighted benefits in technology sharing and manufacturing improvements.

signals.title: Atkinson Equipment Partners with Ceratizit UK & Ireland Ltd for Production Transformation
signals.summary: Ceratizit UK & Ireland Ltd is featured in a December 23, 2025 press release for helping Atkinson Equipment tool up and transform production processes. The collaboration focuses on enhancing manufacturing capabilities through Ceratizit's offerings. Details on specific products or terms are limited in available reports.

signals.title: Cereatech, Inc. to Present at 2025 IAOM Conference & Expo on Mill Flow Lines and Pneumatic Systems
signals.summary: Bulent Ozturk from Cereatech, Inc. is scheduled to present on 'Nervous System of Mills: Flow Lines and Pneumatic Conveying Systems Design' at the 2025 IAOM Conference & Expo. The event preview highlights this session as part of the milling industry's key gatherings. This indicates Cereatech's active involvement in industry events.

signals.title: Chelsea Milling Company Plans $35 Million Expansion to Dramatically Increase Output
signals.summary: Chelsea Milling Co., maker of Jiffy baking mixes, is investing $35 million in a new $25 million mixing tower, packaging plant, and support facility to boost production from 120 million to over 350 million pounds per month. The upgrade targets larger packages for institutional and food service customers like Michigan prisons, while reducing workforce from 315 to 240 through attrition amid retirements. Owner Howdy Holmes emphasized adapting to shifts in consumer behavior toward eating out.

signals.title: Chelsea Milling Incorporates AI System to Improve Ingredient Safety and Compliance
signals.summary: Chelsea Milling has adopted an Intelligent Document Processing (IDP) AI system from TraceGains to automate certificate of analysis (COA) processing, eliminating manual reviews and enhancing accuracy for ingredient quality, safety, and compliance. The system, built on OpenAI's model, flags issues for human oversight and reduces processing time significantly. It supports the Jiffy Mix maker's supply chain efficiency.

signals.title: Color-rich, New Look in a Jiffy for Chelsea Milling Co. Packaging
signals.summary: Chelsea Milling Co. has introduced a color-rich new packaging design for its Jiffy products, highlighting the critical role of packaging in product sales. The update, noted on December 22, 2025, refreshes the iconic branding. This development underscores ongoing innovation in visual appeal for the baking mix line.

signals.title: Columbia/Okura Announces Strategic Alliance with Universal Robots
signals.summary: Columbia/Okura LLC has announced a strategic alliance with Universal Robots to deliver an extensive range of collaborative robot solutions. This partnership enables the development of collaborative palletizing applications using Universal Robots' technology.[1][2]

signals.title: Columbia/Okura Unveils miniPAL+ Collaborative Palletizer with Universal Robots
signals.summary: Columbia/Okura introduces the miniPAL+, a new collaborative palletizing solution featuring Universal Robot's UR20 cobot arm with a 44-lb lifting capacity. This product launch ties into their recent partnership for enhanced palletizing applications.[2][5]

signals.title: Conagra Brands Reports Q2 Loss with $968M Impairment Charge but Reaffirms Fiscal 2026 Guidance
signals.summary: Conagra Brands reported a net loss of $663.6 million for its fiscal Q2 ended November 23, 2025, due to a $968 million non-cash goodwill impairment triggered by a sustained stock price decline and higher discount rates. Despite soft demand, declining volumes, and sales drop to $2.98 billion, the company maintained its full-year outlook of net sales between -1% to +1% and adjusted EPS of $1.70-$1.85. Management expressed optimism for organic net sales growth in the second half, focusing on frozen foods, snacks, and value-led innovation.

signals.title: Conagra Brands Reports Q2 Loss with $968M Impairment Charge but Reaffirms Fiscal 2026 Guidance
signals.summary: Conagra Brands reported a net loss of $663.6 million for its fiscal Q2 ended November 23, 2025, due to a $968 million non-cash goodwill impairment triggered by a sustained decline in share price. Despite soft demand, declining volumes, and sales drop to $2.98 billion, the company maintained its full-year forecasts of net sales between a 1% decline and 1% rise, and adjusted EPS of $1.70-$1.85. Management expressed optimism about momentum in frozen foods and snacks, planning continued margin investment for volume growth.

signals.title: Corbion Signs USD 100 Million Debt Issuance in US Private Placement Market
signals.summary: Corbion announced a Note Purchase Agreement for USD 100 million at a fixed 5.11% interest rate with 7-year maturity, signed on November 7, 2025. Final closing and funding are set for December 18, 2025, with proceeds to repay maturing debt. This aligns Corbion's debt maturity profile.

signals.title: Corbion Shares Dip After Unveiling BRIGHT 2030 Strategy at Capital Markets Day
signals.summary: Corbion presented its BRIGHT 2030 strategy on November 20, 2025, targeting 3-6% organic sales growth for 2026-2028, 18% EBITDA margin by 2028, €270 million cumulative free cash flow, and double-digit EPS growth. Shares fell despite positive long-term targets. The strategy highlights operational streamlining and balance sheet strengthening.

signals.title: Bluebird Flour from Cortez Milling Flies Out the Door Due to High Demand
signals.summary: Bluebird Flour, manufactured at Cortez Milling in Southwest Colorado's grain basket northwest of Cortez, is praised for its freshness and local production. The flour sells out quickly once milled, highlighting strong consumer demand for local products.

signals.title: Cotecna Approved as Amazon TIC Direct Validation Body
signals.summary: Cotecna has been officially recognized by Amazon as an approved Direct Validation (DV) body for categories including children’s toys, e-mobility devices, and accessories. This approval enables Cotecna to provide testing, compliance validation, and direct submission of results to Amazon, helping sellers meet requirements and expand into North America and Europe. Services include global compliance testing, documentation review, and process optimization.

signals.title: ACT Lab Approved as Amazon DV Provider and Shares Compliance Updates
signals.summary: The ACT Lab December 2025 Newsletter highlights its approval as an Amazon Document Validation (DV) TIC provider for e-mobility devices in the U.S., Canada, and U.K. It also covers the reinstatement of EN 15194 for e-bikes in Australia and essential CPSC e-filing processes for 2026 compliance. These updates support manufacturers in navigating regulatory changes.

signals.title: Cotecna Launches New Consumer Product Services (CPS) Website
signals.summary: Cotecna has launched a dedicated website for its Consumer Product Services (CPS), showcasing testing, inspection, certification, audit, and ESG services for softlines, hardlines, furniture, electrical, and electronic products. The site details testing for chemicals, reliability, physical properties, RF, and energy efficiency, along with full-cycle inspection services.

signals.title: Cotecna Brazil Introduces New Infosheet for Textiles and General Cargo Services
signals.summary: Cotecna Brazil released a new infosheet detailing its inspection, testing, and audit solutions for the textile and industrial goods markets. The services aim to enhance supply chain transparency, regulatory compliance, and product quality for local manufacturers and importers.

signals.title: Cotecna Launches FSC Chain of Custody Certification Services
signals.summary: Cotecna has launched FSC Chain of Custody Certification services to certify products from responsibly sourced forests. This new offering supports clients in verifying sustainable sourcing practices.

signals.title: Cotecna Consumer Product Services from Factory to Shelf
signals.summary: Cotecna published an overview of its full service scope for Consumer Product Services, covering testing, inspection, and certification from factory production to shelf placement. This highlights comprehensive support for consumer product compliance.

signals.title: Dakota Gold Expansion Drilling Intersects High-Grade Gold Mineralization at Richmond Hill
signals.summary: Dakota Gold Corp. announced on December 23, 2025, additional 2025 drill results from the Richmond Hill oxide heap leach project, including expansion holes extending gold mineralization 230 meters north of the current resource. Highlights include RH25C-295: 2.15 g/t Au over 30.0 m and RH25C-288: 4.15 g/t Au over 14.5 m, with the company having completed 242 drill holes totaling 29,279 meters and 106 assays pending. Northern mineralization remains open, supporting plans for ~27,500 m of drilling in 2025.[1][8]

signals.title: Dakota Gold Reaches New 1-Year High Stock Price
signals.summary: On December 22, 2025, Dakota Gold (NYSE:DC) hit a new 52-week high of $6.10, up ~4.7%, with a market cap of ~$690.3M, amid ongoing Richmond Hill project developments. The stock price reached $6.23 as of December 26, 2025, reflecting positive market sentiment toward the company's exploration progress in South Dakota's Homestake District.[1][5]

signals.title: Disney Cruise Line Postpones Disney Adventure Maiden Voyage to March 2026
signals.summary: Disney Cruise Line has delayed the maiden voyage of its largest ship, Disney Adventure, from December 15, 2025, to March 10, 2026, due to construction delays. Affected guests will be rebooked with a 50% discount, and those on earlier voyages receive full refunds plus the discount offer. The ship remains on track for Singapore-based operations in Southeast Asia.

signals.title: Disney Cruise Line Takes Delivery of Largest Ship Disney Adventure
signals.summary: Disney Cruise Line formally took delivery of Disney Adventure, its largest vessel at 208,000 gross tons, from Meyer Werft shipyard on December 16, 2025. The handover ceremony marked the transition to final outfitting, including interior theming and crew training, ahead of its March 2026 debut from Singapore. This expands DCL's fleet to eight ships and marks its entry into the Southeast Asian market.

signals.title: Disney Destiny to Commence Sailings in December 2025
signals.summary: Disney Cruise Line announced that its new heroes and villains-themed ship, Disney Destiny, will begin revenue operations and maiden voyage from Fort Lauderdale in December 2025. This Wish-class ship is part of DCL's expansion plans, unaffected by other delays.

signals.title: Spat Over 'Healthy Pasta' Settles for $7.9 Million
signals.summary: A class action lawsuit against Dakota Growers Pasta Co. over false claims about Dreamfields pasta's glycemic index and digestive carbs has settled for $7.9 million. The settlement resolves allegations under the New Jersey Consumer Fraud Act and other state laws, with Dakota Growers denying wrongdoing but agreeing to avoid trial. Final approval was granted by a New Jersey federal judge.

signals.title: North Dakota Mill CEO Vance Taylor to Retire After 25 Years of Record-Setting Leadership
signals.summary: North Dakota Mill President and CEO Vance Taylor plans to retire on July 3, 2026, after over 25 years in the role, the longest-serving in the mill's 103-year history. Under his leadership, the mill innovated, expanded, and generated record profits, including major capital investments and facility upgrades. A nationwide search is underway for a successor to ensure a smooth transition.

signals.title: North Dakota Mill Reports Profit Increase for FY 2025
