Consumption and trade are also expected to hit new highs, with ending stocks reaching 618 million tonnes. Soybean production holds steady at around 428 million tonnes year-on-year.

signals.title: Intertek 2025 Half Year Results Announcement
signals.summary: Intertek reported half-year revenue of £1,673m, up 4.5% at constant currency, with robust like-for-like growth of 4.5% driven by Consumer Products. Adjusted EPS grew 12.6% at constant currency, cash conversion reached 118%, and the company acquired TESIS in Brazil while increasing investments in growth. Intertek expects strong 2025 performance with mid-single digit LFL revenue growth and a new margin target of 18.5%+.

signals.title: Intertek Expands Pharmaceutical Services Capacity with Acquisition of New Facility in Melbourn, Cambridge
signals.summary: Intertek acquired a new 29,000 sq ft facility adjacent to its existing Melbourn site to boost GMP manufacturing for inhaled and nasal drug products, responding to growing demand in innovative drug development. The facility will enable simultaneous clinical trial manufacturing campaigns and enhance capabilities in analytical testing and formulation for biopharmaceuticals. Initial opening is planned for Q2 2026 with further expansions through 2028.

signals.title: Intertek Strengthens Products Testing Business with Acquisition of Professional Testing Laboratory (PTL)
signals.summary: Intertek acquired PTL, a leading US-based provider of flooring products testing services, to expand its Total Quality Assurance offerings in the high-growth North American flooring market valued at $376bn. The deal creates synergies, strengthens regional presence in the Southeast US, and positions Intertek to serve major retailers and expand internationally. CEO André Lacroix highlighted its complementarity to existing capabilities.

signals.title: JesIntake® 30 & 70 Redesigned: Efficient, Accurate and Ready to Deliver
signals.summary: Jesma Weighing Solutions is introducing the redesigned JesIntake® 30, 70, and 150 models, with the 30 and 70 now available as stock items for faster delivery. This launch sets a new standard for efficiency and accuracy in weighing solutions. A special promotional price is offered until December 31, 2025.

signals.title: K-State Names Nick Toth New Linebackers Coach
signals.summary: Kansas State University Athletics announced Nick Toth as the new linebackers coach for the football team. This executive change in the athletics department aims to strengthen the coaching staff following recent updates. The appointment was made on December 22, 2025.

signals.title: CK Supply Breaks Ground on $10M Missouri Expansion
signals.summary: CK Supply Inc., a leader in industrial gases and welding supplies, announced a more than $10 million expansion in Riverside, Missouri, set to become a central hub for the Kansas City region. The project will enhance operational capacity, create new jobs, and serve a 200-mile radius amid growing demand. It follows recent milestones like the 2023 acquisition of Welds Supply Inc. and a 2021 Employee Ownership Stock Plan transition.

signals.title: Kamehameha Schools Trustee Finalists Face Challenging Future
signals.summary: Three men are finalists to lead Kamehameha Schools, one of the largest charitable trusts, amid challenges including land management of over 300,000 acres and expanding access to education. Candidates propose building more campuses, increasing investments, and forming real estate partnerships like with Ko Olina resorts. A court master suggested selling some lands to avoid lawsuits.

signals.title: Hawaii Pacific Health and Kamehameha Schools Renew Partnership
signals.summary: Hawaii Pacific Health and Kamehameha Schools renewed their partnership with a new memorandum of understanding, focusing on education, health, economic stability, and Native Hawaiian community health. They will share data for research on health disparities and continue initiatives like local food investments and workforce development. Leaders celebrated the renewal at the Kapalama campus.

signals.title: Kamehameha Schools Announces Tuition-Free Education Starting 2026-27
signals.summary: Kamehameha Schools will eliminate tuition for its preschools and K-12 campuses starting the 2026-27 academic year, covering full costs with its $15 billion endowment pending Probate Court approval. The move aligns with founder Princess Bernice Pauahi Bishop's intent, shifting from transactional tuition to values-based responsibility. The announcement occurs amid a lawsuit challenging its Native Hawaiian admissions preference.

signals.title: Kepler Weber Suspends Dividend Payments Amid Market Turmoil
signals.summary: Kepler Weber (KEPL3) has suspended its dividend payments in response to ongoing market challenges. This decision reflects caution amid financial pressures affecting the company's liquidity and stability.

signals.title: Kepler Weber Q3 2025 Earnings: Misses EPS Forecast but Shows International Growth
signals.summary: Kepler Weber reported mixed Q3 2025 results, missing EPS expectations while revenue remained steady; international business and ports segments offset domestic weaknesses. The stock rose 6.58% post-announcement, with CEO emphasizing operational efficiency and new orders worth 257.2 million reais.

signals.title: Kerry Group Reports 3% Volume Growth Ahead of End Markets in First Nine Months of 2025
signals.summary: Kerry Group PLC reported 3% on-year volume growth for the first nine months of 2025, outpacing end markets, with strong margin expansion of 90 basis points and pricing up 0.2%. The company highlighted good growth in the Americas supported by product launches and reaffirmed full-year guidance amid soft consumer demand. Shares rose 3.7% following the announcement.

signals.title: Kerry Highlights Citrus Supply Chain Challenges and Future Opportunities
signals.summary: Dr. Zareena Valappil, Kerry's Global VP of Citrus, outlined risks like weather patterns, regional dependency, and citrus greening disease impacting supply stability. Kerry is innovating with next-generation citrus extracts and sustainable extenders to help customers manage volatility. Opportunities identified include functional beverages, exotic varieties, and sustainability-focused products.

signals.title: Kerry Group Executes Share Buyback on December 19, 2025
signals.summary: Kerry Group plc announced the purchase of its A ordinary shares on Friday, December 19, 2025, as part of its ongoing repurchase program. This regulatory filing details the number of shares acquired.

signals.title: Juan Aguiriano, Kerry Group Chief Sustainability Officer, Calls for Climate Action in Food Industry
signals.summary: Juan Aguiriano, Chief Sustainability Officer at Kerry Group, published an article on December 26, 2025, urging courage, collaboration, and science in addressing climate challenges through food industry actions. The piece emphasizes placing food at the heart of climate initiatives.

signals.title: Kerry Jackson Reappointed as Shoe Carnival CFO in Evansville, IN
signals.summary: Kerry Jackson, a 35-year veteran and former CFO of Shoe Carnival based in Evansville, Indiana, will retake the finance chief role effective September 28, 2025, to support the company's organic and acquisition growth plans. Jackson rejoined in June 2025 as senior vice president of new business development after a brief hiatus. The move aligns with Shoe Carnival's strategic expansion of its Shoe Station segment and updated fiscal 2025 guidance.

signals.title: Old National Bank Announces Partnership with Bremer Financial Corp.
signals.summary: Old National Bank, headquartered in Evansville, IN, has entered a definitive merger agreement with Bremer Financial Corp., expanding its footprint into Minnesota, North Dakota, and Wisconsin with 70 branches. The transaction, unanimously approved by both boards, is expected to close mid-2025 and strengthens Old National's presence in the Twin Cities. CEO Jim Ryan highlighted the cultural and strategic alignment between the community-focused banks.

signals.title: Sun’aq Tribe of Kodiak Receives $2.3 Million Grant to Build Kelp Processing Facility
signals.summary: The Sun’aq Tribe of Kodiak has been awarded a $2.3 million grant from the Alaska Mariculture Cluster to develop the Kelp Primary Processing Platform (KP3), a centralized facility for kelp producers. The facility will produce products like dried kelp, biostimulants, and extracts, aiming to expand the mariculture industry, create jobs, and support the regional economy. Tribal leaders hailed it as a major milestone for community growth.

signals.title: Kodiak Sciences Closes $184 Million Public Offering of Common Stock
signals.summary: Kodiak Sciences Inc. completed a public offering of 8 million shares at $23 per share, raising approximately $184 million in gross proceeds before expenses. The funds will support Phase 3 trials for retinal therapeutics KSI-101, KSI-501, and tarcocimab, repay debt, and bolster financial stability ahead of 2026 data readouts. CEO Victor Perlroth stated it strengthens their position for key clinical milestones.

signals.title: Pantheon Resources Updates on Kodiak Acreage with Dubhe-1 Results and Cash Position
signals.summary: Pantheon Resources reported a $27.2 million cash position as of December 21, 2025, confirmed mobile hydrocarbons at Dubhe-1 in the Kodiak acreage, and reiterated contingent resources of about 1.6 billion barrels of liquids. However, production yielded only ~100 barrels of oil with testing paused due to winter, and commerciality remains undetermined amid high flowback costs. The company plans to resume testing and optimize for commercialization.

signals.title: Leewens Corp. Cited in Washington State L&I Director's Order for Payment Enforcement
signals.summary: The Washington State Labor & Industries department issued a Director's Order against Leewens Corporation, upholding a February 2024 redetermination in a January 2025 reconsideration. The order states the department's intent to enforce payment related to workers' rights issues. This regulatory action highlights ongoing compliance matters for the company.[4]

signals.title: Lacey Mills Closing Georgia Rug Plant
signals.summary: The Lacey Mills plant in Bartow County, Georgia, is set to close by December 2025, as announced by parent company Bacova Guild Ltd. This closure impacts operations at the facility. The news was reported on December 23, 2025.

signals.title: Lambton Conveyor Ltd. Announces Employees of the Month for November 2025
signals.summary: Lambton Conveyor Ltd. recognized Jordan Lubben and Robert Mobley Jr. as employees of the month for November 2025. They excelled in streamlining operations and improving organization at the Lambton Iowa plant through leadership, process revitalization, and dedication to efficiency. The company congratulated them for their outstanding contributions and positive impact.

signals.title: Lambton Conveyor Ltd. Donates to R.O.C.K Missions This Holiday Season
signals.summary: Lambton Conveyor Ltd. announced a holiday season donation to R.O.C.K Missions to support those in need within the community. The company expressed pride in its community support efforts. They extended Merry Christmas wishes alongside the announcement.

signals.title: Lambton Conveyor Ltd. Adjusts Operating Hours for Holiday Season
signals.summary: Lambton Conveyor Ltd. informed customers of adjusted regular hours during the holiday season to allow the team time with loved ones. The announcement wishes everyone a Merry Christmas and Happy New Year. It highlights the company's appreciation for its employees.

signals.title: Lambton Conveyor's Engineering Manager Discusses Trends in Grain-Handling Systems
signals.summary: Ryan Deline, engineering manager at Lambton Conveyor, highlighted shifts in Western Canadian grain-handling towards gentle product management and permanent loop systems. These changes aim to preserve crop quality, minimize damage during transfer, reduce labor needs, and support future expansion. The trends address challenges like tight harvest windows and quality demands for export markets.

signals.title: Lambton Conveyor Announces Employees of the Month for November 2025
signals.summary: Lambton Conveyor Ltd. named Jordan Lubben and Robert Mobley Jr. as employees of the month for November 2025. They are recognized for streamlining operations, improving organization at the Lambton Iowa plant, and demonstrating leadership in process revitalization. Their efforts have boosted efficiency and set an example of continuous improvement.

signals.title: Lambton Conveyor Donates to R.O.C.K. Missions This Holiday Season
signals.summary: Lambton Conveyor Ltd. announced a donation to R.O.C.K. Missions to support those in need during the holiday season. The company expressed pride in supporting the community. They extended Merry Christmas wishes.

signals.title: Lambton Conveyor Adjusts Operating Hours for Holiday Season
signals.summary: Lambton Conveyor Ltd. informed that regular hours will be adjusted during the holiday season to allow the team time with loved ones. The announcement wishes everyone a Merry Christmas and Happy New Year. No specific hour details were provided.

signals.title: Lambton Conveyor Engineering Manager Highlights Trends in Grain Handling Equipment
signals.summary: Ryan Deline, engineering manager at Lambton Conveyor, discussed the shift toward permanent grain loop systems and gentle handling equipment to preserve crop quality and reduce labor needs. These systems minimize damage during transfer, addressing demands for high-quality grain exports and tight harvest windows. Producers are prioritizing expandable setups over cheaper alternatives.

signals.title: Mennel Milling Completes Acquisition of Mondelez International's Toledo Flour Mill
signals.summary: Mennel Milling Company has completed the acquisition of the Toledo Flour Mill from Mondelez International, a major facility with capacity for 4 million pounds of soft wheat flour per day. This move strengthens Mennel's position as the fourth-largest milling company in the US, enhances production capabilities, and allows expansion into new markets while continuing to supply Mondelez. The acquisition reflects Mennel's strategy for growth amid competitive pressures.

signals.title: Mennel Leave a Legacy Program Supports Local Charities on Giving Tuesday
signals.summary: Mennel hosted its fourth annual Leave a Legacy charitable giving campaign from November 7-30, 2025, supporting local charities. The initiative underscores the company's community involvement and commitment to giving back.

signals.title: Loews Corporation Elects Dino Robusto to Its Board of Directors
signals.summary: Loews Corporation announced the election of Dino Robusto to its board of directors, effective January 1, 2026. This leadership update strengthens the company's governance structure ahead of the new year.

signals.title: HF Sinclair (NYSE:DINO) Joins Russell 1000 ETF Energy Leaders
signals.summary: HF Sinclair Corporation (NYSE:DINO) has joined the Russell 1000 ETF Energy Leaders, highlighting its role in refining innovation and renewable energy integration. This inclusion recognizes the company's strategic advancements in the energy sector.

signals.title: Louis Dreyfus Company Announces the Passing of the Group's Chief Financial Officer, Patrick Treuer
signals.summary: Louis Dreyfus Company announced that its CFO, Patrick Treuer, passed away unexpectedly on December 24, 2025. Treuer, who joined in 2014, significantly contributed to the company's growth through his financial expertise. A successor will be announced in due course.[1][4][5]

signals.title: Louis Dreyfus Struggles to Hang on to Its Talent in Ethiopia
signals.summary: Louis Dreyfus is facing challenges retaining talent, with two leading traders from its small team in Ethiopia submitting resignations in December 2025. This reflects broader shifts prompting staff departures at the firm.[8]

signals.title: MGP Ingredients Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results and Raises Full-Year Guidance
signals.summary: MGP Ingredients reported Q3 2025 consolidated sales of $130.9M (down 19% YoY), adjusted EBITDA of $32.3M (down 29%), and adjusted EPS of $0.85 (down 34%), amid brown goods declines and Ingredient Solutions challenges. The company raised its full-year adjusted EBITDA guidance to $110-115M, tightened sales to $525-535M, and set adjusted EPS at $2.60-2.75. Year-to-date operating cash flow increased 26% to $92.5M.

signals.title: MGP Ingredients Announces Board Transition: Karen Seaberg Retires, Julie Francis Appointed
signals.summary: Karen Seaberg retired from the Board of Directors effective December 14, 2025, after over 15 years of service, including as Chairman from 2014 to 2024. Julie Francis, president and CEO, was appointed to the Board effective December 15, 2025, to provide operational perspective for long-term strategy execution. The transition was praised for Seaberg's steady leadership and Francis's strategic focus.

signals.title: GLP-1 Drugs Impact MGP Ingredients Amid Excess Bourbon Inventory and Alcohol Consumption Shifts
signals.summary: MGP Ingredients faced headwinds from increased GLP-1 drug usage affecting consumer alcohol consumption, contributing to excess inventory especially in bourbon. This was noted as a detractor in Mairs & Power Small Cap Fund's Q3 2025 investor letter, with MGPI shares down 43.49% over 52 weeks and closing at $26.35 on December 10, 2025. The company continues navigating industry-wide shifts.

signals.title: MGP Ingredients Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
signals.summary: MGP Ingredients reported solid Q3 2025 results with consolidated sales of $130.9M, adjusted EBITDA of $32.3M, and raised full-year guidance for adjusted EBITDA to $110-115M and EPS to $2.60-2.75. Despite declines in brown goods due to customer inventory rebalancing, premium-plus brands grew and Ingredient Solutions sales rose 9% to $29.3M. Management highlighted operational improvements and long-term value creation.

signals.title: MGP Ingredients Announces Board Transition
signals.summary: Karen Seaberg retired from the Board of Directors effective December 14, 2025, after over 15 years of service, including as Chairman from 2014 to 2024. Julie Francis, president and CEO, was appointed to the Board effective December 15, 2025. This leadership update reflects continuity with the current executive at the helm.

signals.title: MGP Ingredients Stock Surges 7% on Strong Buy Analyst Rating
signals.summary: MGP Ingredients shares rose 7% on December 5, 2025, following a Strong Buy average rating from analysts, signaling positive market expectations. The move came amid focus on Q3 results beating estimates and raised full-year profit forecasts, despite year-over-year declines. Investors reacted favorably to the company's resilience and outlook.

signals.title: Milltek End of Year Flash Sale Announced
signals.summary: Milltek Sport launched an end-of-year flash sale on December 24, 2025, allowing customers to beat the 2026 price increases. This promotional event highlights ongoing business activity as the year closes.

signals.title: Life at Milltek 2025 Highlights Growth and Launches
signals.summary: Milltek reported 2025 as a year of significant growth, including the launch of the Milltek Design range. Milltek Corp also secured its space, marking expansion in operations.

signals.title: Milltek Active in Motorsport Events Across UK and Europe in 2025
signals.summary: In 2025, Milltek participated in multiple motorsport events including circuit racing, rally, and drifting throughout the UK and Europe. This involvement underscores brand engagement in the performance sector.

signals.title: AGI Closes $85 Million Public Offering of Senior Subordinated Unsecured Debentures
signals.summary: On June 9, 2025, AGI completed an $85 million public offering of debentures, with proceeds used to repay credit lines for general corporate purposes. This financial move supports AGI's operations, including its Milltec subsidiary acquired earlier.

signals.title: Milltek Extends Sponsorship of Civic Cup for Sixth Consecutive Season
signals.summary: Milltek Sport has committed to title sponsor the Civic Cup for the sixth straight year in 2025, with the season spanning seven events including support for TCR UK and British Truck Racing. The series features Honda Civic Type R cars equipped with Milltek exhausts and is recognized as one of the UK's toughest one-make championships. Executives from both sides expressed enthusiasm for the continued partnership and growth.

signals.title: Milltek Unleashes New Valved Performance Exhaust for BMW E92 M3
signals.summary: Milltek has launched a new valved performance exhaust system for the BMW E92 M3, dated October 2, 2025, enhancing sound and performance. This product falls under Milltek's innovation in performance exhausts.

signals.title: Milltek End of Year Flash Sale Announced
signals.summary: Milltek launched an end-of-year flash sale on December 24, 2025, allowing customers to beat 2026 price increases on performance exhausts.

signals.title: City of Moline Breaks Ground on $120 Million South Slope Wastewater Treatment Plant Upgrade
signals.summary: The City of Moline has officially broken ground on a $120 million upgrade to its South Slope Wastewater Treatment Plant, funded by a low-interest loan from the Illinois Environmental Protection Agency at 1.9% over 30 years. The multi-year project, led by IHC Construction Companies, will modernize outdated facilities, enhance treatment processes, and add advanced phosphorus removal systems to meet IEPA compliance requirements. Mayor Sangeetha Rayapati described it as one of the largest infrastructure investments in the city's history, ensuring reliable water treatment for future growth.

signals.title: MONISA Invests $5 Million in New Modern Flour Mill in Granada to Boost Exports
signals.summary: Molinos de Nicaragua S.A. (MONISA) is constructing a state-of-the-art plant in Granada, including a new wheat mill with a capacity of 250 metric tons daily, backed by a $5 million investment. This will enable production of various flour types like extra strong, soft, and integral for bread, cookies, and pastries, while enhancing exports to Central America. The project also includes a new four-story office building and is generating jobs in the local economy.

signals.title: Silo Pharma CEO Eric Weisblum Purchases Additional Shares in Insider Trading Activity
signals.summary: On December 16, 2025, Silo Pharma's Chief Executive Officer Eric Weisblum bought 2,500 shares at prices of $0.42 and $0.41, totaling approximately $2,080. This continues a pattern of insider buying by the CEO throughout 2025. The transactions signal confidence in the company's future prospects.

signals.title: Silo Pharma CEO Eric Weisblum Purchases Additional Shares in Insider Trading Activity
signals.summary: On December 16, 2025, Silo Pharma CEO Eric Weisblum bought 2,500 shares at $0.42 and another 2,500 at $0.41, signaling confidence in the company's future. This recent insider buying follows previous purchases by the CEO. The transactions occurred within the past 11 days.

signals.title: Silo Pharma Receives Nasdaq Notice for Minimum Bid Price Noncompliance
signals.summary: Silo Pharma was notified by Nasdaq of noncompliance with the minimum bid price rule and has until December 24, 2025, to regain compliance. The company is also advancing its Bitcoin treasury allocation up to $1 million and a drug-device study for SPC-15. This development poses a regulatory challenge but includes positive strategic updates.

signals.title: Esaote Installs First Magnifico Open MRI Scanner in the U.S.
signals.summary: Esaote has installed the first Magnifico Open MRI scanner in the United States, marking a key expansion of its advanced imaging technology into the American market. This installation highlights the scanner's readiness for clinical use following its recent introduction.

signals.title: Esaote North America Unveils Magnifico Vet Open MRI System
signals.summary: Esaote North America has released the Magnifico Vet MRI system, a new open MRI solution tailored for veterinary applications. It provides diagnostic efficacy across various veterinary imaging needs.

signals.title: Esaote Introduces Magnifico Open Whole-Body MRI Scanner
signals.summary: Esaote launched the Magnifico Open, a new whole-body open MRI scanner designed to broaden patient access to MRI technology. The system aims to serve a wider selection of patients with its open design.

signals.title: Marcel Wanders Unveils Magnifico Mirror Collection with FIAM Italia
signals.summary: Marcel Wanders has unveiled the Magnifico Mirror Collection in collaboration with FIAM Italia, continuing their partnership since 2017. The collection features large-scale mirrors in silver, bronze, and smoke finishes that serve as both functional and sculptural elements.

signals.title: Duo-Lift Acquires Linco-Precision, Expanding Dealer Network to Include Mandako Equipment
signals.summary: In August 2025, Duo-Lift Manufacturing acquired Linco-Precision in El Paso, Ill., entering the shortline dealer landscape. The new facility supports assembly and distribution for Busch Equipment lines, including Mandako products, reducing freight costs and improving service to end users. This vertical integration allows better control over product distribution for shortline manufacturers like Mandako.

signals.title: Full Line Ag Sales Ltd, Dealer of Mandako, Named 2025 NAEDA Merit Award Dealer of the Year
signals.summary: On December 5, 2025, NAEDA announced Terry and Gerald Swystun of Full Line Ag Sales Ltd as the 2025 Merit Award Dealer of the Year. The Saskatchewan dealership represents Mandako among other brands and has earned top AGCO awards for volume and performance. This recognition highlights their growth and community impact in agriculture.

signals.title: Mandako Storm Advanced Tillage Solution Featured at 2025 Iowa Ag Expo
signals.summary: The Mandako Storm, an advanced tillage tool with cutting-edge innovation, is showcased at booth #4408 during the Iowa Ag Expo on February 4-6, 2025. This promotion targets farmers' demands for efficient tillage solutions. It represents Mandako's ongoing product offerings in the ag equipment market.

signals.title: Manitoba Government Launches $10 Million Business Security Rebate Program
signals.summary: The Manitoba government has launched a $10 million Business Security Rebate Program to provide rebates to businesses on a first-come, first-served basis. This funding initiative aims to enhance business security across the province.

signals.title: AGI Provides Bi-Weekly Status Report on Management Cease Trade Order
signals.summary: Ag Growth International Inc., based in Winnipeg, Manitoba, issued a bi-weekly status report on its Management Cease Trade Order granted by the Manitoba Securities Commission due to delayed Q3 financial filings. The company anticipates completing the required filings soon and has declared a dividend payable in January 2026.

signals.title: Manitoba Finance Minister Discusses Second Quarter Fiscal Report
signals.summary: Manitoba Finance Minister Adrien Sala presented the province's second quarter report, noting challenges from U.S. tariffs, wildfires, and climate change but highlighting economic resilience and a historic capital plan. The government announced an economic development strategy including a PST exemption on manufacturing machinery to boost investment and jobs.

signals.title: Mars Finalizes Kellanova Acquisition
signals.summary: Mars Inc. completed its acquisition of Kellanova on December 17, 2025, integrating brands like Pringles, Pop-Tarts, and Cheez-It into its Snacking portfolio. Andrew Clarke, global president of Mars Snacking, highlighted the transformative moment and future innovations. The deal positions Mars to generate $36 billion annually with nine billion-dollar brands.

signals.title: Mars Receives Final EU Approval for $36B Kellanova Acquisition
signals.summary: The European Commission unconditionally approved Mars' $36 billion acquisition of Kellanova on December 7-8, 2025, clearing the last regulatory hurdle. Mars anticipates closing on December 11, with executives expressing excitement about combining portfolios for innovation and growth. The deal enhances Mars' snacking presence globally.

signals.title: Mars Celebrates Key Milestone in Pending Kellanova Acquisition
signals.summary: Mars announced final regulatory approval for its Kellanova acquisition on December 8, 2025, expecting closure on December 11. CEO Poul Weihrauch and global snacking president Andrew Clarke emphasized welcoming employees and creating a more innovative snacking business. The combined entity will oversee major brands and drive consumer choice.

signals.title: Mars Launches Holiday Seasonal Snacks Including Twix Snowmen and M&M’s Winter Blend
signals.summary: Mars released a line of holiday treats in November 2025, such as Twix Snowmen, Snickers Trees, and M&M’s Winter Blend, amid consumer demand for seasonal snacks. Allison Miazga-Bedrick, VP of seasonal marketing for Mars Wrigley North America, noted their role in holiday cheer. This aligns with industry trends in candy and snacks.

signals.title: Mennel Milling Acquires Toledo Flour Mill from Mondelez International
signals.summary: Mennel Milling Company completed the acquisition of the Toledo Flour Mill from Mondelez International on October 31, 2025, enhancing its production capacity for soft wheat flour and solidifying its position as the fourth-largest milling company in the US. The facility will continue supplying flour to Mondelez and enable expansion into new markets. President and CEO D. Ford Mennel emphasized the strategic growth and commitment to customer needs amid competitive conditions.

signals.title: Mennel Milling & Bakery Mix - Martel Receives FY25 Plant of the Year Award
signals.summary: In September 2025, the leadership team of Mennel Milling & Bakery Mix - Martel accepted the FY25 Plant of the Year Award, recognizing operational excellence. This internal accolade highlights the facility's performance within the company.

signals.title: Mennel Grain West Point Completes Major Upgrades
signals.summary: On August 27, 2025, Mennel announced the completion of a major rebuild and modernization project at its West Point, Virginia grain elevator, following demolition and extensive site work. The upgrades improve facility capabilities.

signals.title: Mennel Grain Facility Undergoes Major Renovations
signals.summary: The Mennel Grain facility had a soft opening during Wheat Harvest 2025, with full operations anticipated during Corn Harvest 2025. The renovation enhances operational capabilities. This supports Menrex Processing & Packing as part of Mennel Milling.

signals.title: Mennel Milling Completes Acquisition of Toledo Flour Mill from Mondelez
signals.summary: The Mennel Milling Company announced the acquisition of the Toledo, Ohio flour mill from Mondelez International on October 31, 2025, strengthening its operations. This move offers insight into dramatic changes in the flour milling industry. It bolsters Mennel's processing and packing capabilities including Menrex.

signals.title: Mennel Acquisition Offers Glimpse into Decade of Change in Flour Milling
signals.summary: Mennel Milling's acquisition highlights significant shifts in the flour milling industry over the past decade. It reflects consolidation and adaptation trends affecting companies like Menrex Processing & Packing. Published around December 16, 2025.

signals.title: Metalmec Announces Winter Office Closure from December 22, 2025 to January 6, 2026
signals.summary: Metalmec has informed customers that its offices will be closed for the winter break starting December 22, 2025, until January 6, 2026. This operational update ensures customers are aware of the holiday schedule.

signals.title: METRO AG Reports Strong FY 2024/25 Results with 6% Sales Growth and Raised Outlook for 2025/26
signals.summary: METRO AG achieved 6% sales growth to €32 billion in FY 2024/25, driven by delivery business (+14% to €9 billion) and own brand sales (+€1 billion). Operational EBITDA rose significantly, supporting further investments. Management anticipates 3-6% sales growth and €50-150 million EBITDA increase in FY 2025/26.

signals.title: METRO AG Supervisory Board Extends Management Board Contracts Until 2030
signals.summary: The Supervisory Board extended contracts of CEO Dr. Steffen Greubel, COO Christiane Giesen, CFO Eric Riegger, and Chief Customer Officer Guillaume Deruyter until December 31, 2030. This ensures leadership continuity during the sCore strategy implementation. The move signals confidence in the team's progress toward growth targets.

signals.title: EP Global Commerce Announces €2 Billion Public Offer for METRO AG
signals.summary: EP Global Commerce GmbH, controlled by Daniel Křetínský, launched a €2 billion public offer to acquire all outstanding shares of METRO AG. EPGC already holds 49.99% of shares and aims for delisting. Legal advisors include Paul Weiss and Kirkland & Ellis on financing and structuring.

signals.title: METRO AG Completes Strategic Acquisitions Including GVS in May 2025
signals.summary: METRO expanded its Food Service Distribution (FSD) capacities through the acquisition of GVS in May 2025, following prior deals like JHB, Donier, and Caterite. This supports growth in delivery and strategic customer initiatives. Adjusted EBITDA increased by €111 million excluding GVS impact.

signals.title: Alan E. Mills, President of Milford Grain Co., Passes Away Suddenly
signals.summary: Alan E. Mills, 68, of Milford and current president of Milford Grain Co., passed away suddenly at home on November 29, 2025. A Milford High School graduate, he was actively involved in local organizations including the Cedarfield Ruritan Club and Sussex County Farm Bureau, taking his leadership role at the company seriously to ensure its growth. A funeral service was held on December 6, 2025.

signals.title: Miller Milling Appoints Grant Kadavy as President and CEO
signals.summary: Grant Kadavy has been named president and chief executive officer of Miller Milling Co., succeeding Joe Girdner. Girdner praised Kadavy as a values-driven leader skilled in building high-performance teams and executing long-term strategies. Kadavy brings extensive experience from roles at Darigold, including chief commercial officer and chief operating officer.

signals.title: Miller Milling Promotes Ben Oertel to CFO, Kevin Sebby to VP Sales, and Kyle Shermock to VP Supply Chain
signals.summary: Miller Milling Co. announced promotions on Dec. 20: Ben Oertel to Chief Financial Officer, Kevin Sebby to Vice President of Sales, and Kyle Shermock to Vice President of Supply Chain and Corporate Planning. These changes support the company's focus on growth and long-term strategy.

signals.title: Miller Milling Plant Manager Elected IAOM President
signals.summary: A plant manager from Miller Milling has been elected president of the International Association of Operative Millers (IAOM). This leadership role highlights the company's prominence in the milling industry.

signals.title: IMAS Accepted into TURQUALITY® Support Program Following December 2024 Audit
signals.summary: Following a successful audit on December 12-13, 2024, IMAS has been accepted into the TURQUALITY® support program. This program supports Turkish companies in enhancing brand value and global competitiveness. It represents a key endorsement for IMAS's operations in grain and feed milling under brands like Milleral and Viteral.[6]

signals.title: Sienci Labs Reports Sales Doubling in 2025 with ATC Launch and Production Updates
signals.summary: Sienci Labs announced in their December 2025 production update that company sales have doubled from 2024, driven by growth in the AltMill platform. They launched the ATC, new tools, accessories, closed loop stepper motor kit, and auto spin T1, with ongoing production for AltMill 4x8 and spindle deliveries expected in early December.

signals.title: WTX-UNI and WTX-Deep UNI Solid Carbide Drills Introduced for Universal Drilling Applications
signals.summary: The WTX-UNI and WTX-Deep UNI solid carbide drills offer a universal solution for precision drilling across steel, stainless steel, cast iron, and hardened steels up to 54 HRC. They simplify tool selection, streamline inventory, reduce tool changes, and improve machining efficiency.

signals.title: INTEGREX i-350S NEO Multi-Tasking Machine Adds Grinding Capabilities
signals.summary: The new INTEGREX i-350S NEO provides increased thermal stability and combines turning, milling, and grinding operations with advanced automation. It enables high-performance multi-tasking for enhanced manufacturing processes.

signals.title: DN Solutions Launches DLX 450D Industrial 3D Printer Bridging Additive and CNC Processes
signals.summary: DN Solutions introduced the DLX 450D, a high-performance 3D printer for 24/7 production with exchangeable build containers, multi-laser system, and 450mm build volume. It integrates LPBF and CNC processes via software, automation, and handling for scalable turnkey solutions.

signals.title: U.S. Metalworking Machinery Orders Surge 40% Year-Over-Year in October 2025
signals.summary: Demand for metalworking machinery jumped 40% in October 2025 per the USMTO Report by AMT, signaling strong manufacturing confidence and investment momentum despite economic concerns.

signals.title: USDA Supports CTUIR Grain Mill Project with $25M Investment
signals.summary: The USDA has provided a $25 million investment to support the Confederated Tribes of the Umatilla Indian Reservation (CTUIR) grain mill project in Umatilla County. This funding backs a significant development in regional grain milling infrastructure. The announcement was made on December 16, 2025.

signals.title: USDA Supports Umatilla County Grain Mill Project with $25 Million Loan Guarantee
signals.summary: The USDA issued a $25 million loan guarantee for a grain mill project in Umatilla County, advancing local milling capabilities. This support was highlighted in milling industry news on December 22, 2025. It represents a key boost for grain processing in the area.

signals.title: Milltek Sport End of Year Flash Sale Announced
signals.summary: Milltek Sport launched an end of year flash sale on December 24, 2025, encouraging customers to beat the 2026 price increases. This promotional event highlights the company's ongoing business activity during the holiday period.[7]

signals.title: AGI Announces Closing of $85 Million Public Offering of Senior Subordinated Unsecured Debentures
signals.summary: On June 9, 2025, AGI closed an $85 million public offering of debentures, with proceeds used to repay credit lines for general corporate purposes. An over-allotment option for up to $12.75 million was granted to underwriters.[9]

signals.title: SRM Concrete Opens New Ready-Mix Plant in Leander, Texas
signals.summary: SRM Concrete announced the opening of a new dry-batch ready-mix concrete plant in Leander, Texas on December 18, 2025, marking its fifth plant in South-Central Florida. The facility can produce approximately 120 cubic yards of concrete per hour, supporting regional growth following the 2018 acquisition of KMR Concrete. This expansion enhances SRM's service capabilities amid strong demand from large projects.

signals.title: SRM Concrete Acquires Amarillo Redi-Mix, Adding Two Batch Plants
signals.summary: SRM Concrete acquired Amarillo Redi-Mix in Texas, incorporating two ready-mix concrete batch plants and over 35 team members. CEO Jeff Hollingshead highlighted the tuck-in acquisition's role in bolstering service for strong regional projects, including data centers requiring over three million cubic yards of concrete. SRM leverages its vertically integrated model with cement imports, aggregates, and mixer manufacturing.

signals.title: A&Z Pharmaceutical Cuts Blending Cycles by 90% with Munson Machinery Rotary Batch Mixer
signals.summary: Nutraceutical manufacturer A&Z Pharmaceutical expanded its operations and adopted a 40-cu-ft rotary batch mixer from Munson Machinery, reducing blending times from 45-60 minutes to about four minutes while maintaining uniformity. This supports higher throughput on its new nutraceutical production line without compromising GMP standards or product integrity. The mixer excels at partial loads down to 15% capacity.

signals.title: Single-Use Mixers Market Projected to Reach $2.4 Billion by 2029
signals.summary: The single-use mixers market grew from $1.29 billion in 2024 to $1.46 billion in 2025 at a 13.6% CAGR, driven by biopharmaceutical demands for contamination-free mixing in small-batch production. It is forecasted to hit $2.40 billion by 2029 at 13.2% CAGR, fueled by personalized medicine, biologic therapies, and modular facilities. These disposable systems reduce downtime by eliminating cleaning needs.

signals.title: Versuni India Launches Philips HL7773 Mixer Grinder with MicroGrind Technology
signals.summary: In March 2025, Versuni India launched the Philips HL7773 Mixer Grinder range featuring groundbreaking MicroGrind Technology to redefine kitchen experiences. This innovation targets home appliance users seeking advanced blending capabilities. The launch builds on legacy brands like Philips and Preethi.

signals.title: A&Z Pharmaceutical Cuts Blending Cycles by 90% Using Rotary Batch Mixer from Munson Machinery
signals.summary: Nutraceutical manufacturer A&Z Pharmaceutical reduced blending times from 45-60 minutes to about four minutes by adopting a 40-cu-ft rotary batch mixer from Munson Machinery in its expanded Hauppauge facility. This upgrade supports higher throughput while maintaining uniformity and GMP standards for supplements. The change replaced traditional V-cone blenders, enhancing flexibility for partial loads.

signals.title: Single-Use Mixers Market Grows to $1.46 Billion in 2025, Projected to Reach $2.4 Billion by 2029
signals.summary: The single-use mixers market expanded from $1.29 billion in 2024 to $1.46 billion in 2025 at a 13.6% CAGR, driven by biopharmaceutical demands for contamination-free solutions. Growth is fueled by cell and gene therapy investments, small-batch manufacturing, and sustainability focus. Key trends include mixing technology advancements and scalable bioprocessing.

signals.title: Nissin Engineering Launches Fully Automated Bakery Processing Systems with Robotics
signals.summary: In October 2025, Nissin Engineering introduced fully automated bakery processing systems integrated with advanced robotics to boost efficiency in US food operations. This development targets enhanced productivity in bakery mixing and processing. It aligns with broader market growth to $24.19 billion by 2032.

signals.title: Rheon USA Unveils VX132 Artisan Bread Unit and New Bakery Equipment at IBIE 2025
signals.summary: In September 2025, Rheon USA launched the VX132 Artisan Bread Unit with 2-Scale System, Croissant Bender, and Two-Lane Punch Rounder at IBIE 2025. These tools enable precise dough scaling, automated rolling, and reduced manual labor for medium-sized bakeries. The innovations improve consistency in bakery blending processes.

signals.title: Molson Coors Acquires Stake in Cocktail Mixers Maker Fever-Tree
signals.summary: Molson Coors announced a strategic partnership with U.K.-based Fever-Tree, acquiring an 8.5% stake and gaining exclusive U.S. commercialization rights for its tonics, ginger beers, and cocktail mixers. The brewer will handle production, marketing, sales, and distribution in the U.S., aiming to expand the brand's reach. Officials described it as a significant step toward building a total-beverage portfolio.

signals.title: Absolut Mixers Introduces 'The Blue Trail': A Sensory Fusion of Art and Nature at Echoes of Earth 2025
signals.summary: Absolut Mixers launched 'The Blue Trail,' an experiential installation blending art and nature at the Echoes of Earth 2025 event. The initiative highlights a sensory fusion to engage audiences. It represents a creative product promotion in the premium mixers space.

signals.title: Single-Use Mixers Market Projected to Grow to $2.4 Billion by 2029
signals.summary: The single-use mixers market is expanding rapidly, from $1.46 billion in 2025 to $2.40 billion by 2029 at a 13.2% CAGR, driven by biopharmaceutical demands and contamination-free solutions. Growth factors include personalized medicine, biologic therapies, and sustainable practices. Key trends involve mixing technology advancements and scalable systems.

signals.title: MoistTech Highlights IR-3000 Series Sensor for Sustainable Manufacturing
signals.summary: MoistTech Corp. announced on December 22, 2025, the sustainability benefits of its IR-3000 Series Moisture Sensor, which uses NIR technology to reduce material waste, energy consumption, and inefficiencies in industries like textiles, packaging, food processing, and recycling. The sensor provides real-time, non-contact measurements, enabling optimal process control without frequent recalibrations or downtime. It supports environmental goals by minimizing over-drying and enhancing operational efficiency.

signals.title: MoistTech IR3000-W Series Sensors for Wood Products and Bioenergy
signals.summary: MoistTech Corp. promotes its IR3000-W series moisture sensors, featuring NIR technology for accurate, low-maintenance moisture analysis in wood products used in bioenergy production. The sensors address critical moisture concerns impacting product quality, production efficiency, and energy use in the forest industry. They deliver repeatable results year after year.

signals.title: Molinos Modernos, marca de CMI, realizó su Festipan Navideño 2025
signals.summary: Molinos Modernos, a brand of Corporación Multi Inversiones (CMI), hosted its second edition of Festipan Navideño 2025 in Quetzaltenango, gathering over 200 participants to promote bakery and pastry innovation. The event featured product showcases, technical training, and customer support to help businesses expand and diversify offerings. Commercial developer Pablo Ramírez highlighted its role in strengthening client enterprises through product variety and growth opportunities.

signals.title: Molinos Modernos, marca de CMI, realizó su Festipan Navideño 2025
signals.summary: Molinos Modernos, a brand of CMI, held its second edition of Festipan Navideño 2025 in Quetzaltenango, gathering over 200 participants to promote bakery and pastry innovation. The event featured product showcases, technical training, and customer support to help businesses grow and diversify offerings. Pablo Ramírez, commercial developer, emphasized the value in exposing clients to new products and business expansion opportunities.

signals.title: Monarch Casino Reports Record Q3 2025 Financial Results with $31.6M Net Income
signals.summary: Monarch Casino & Resort achieved its highest-ever quarterly results in Q3 2025, with net revenue up 3.6% to $142.8 million and net income rising 14.4% to $31.6 million. Growth was driven by strong casino performance, higher gaming revenue, and improved EBITDA margins to 38.4%. The company maintains a debt-free balance sheet with $107.6 million in cash.

signals.title: The Monarch Cement Company Announces Special Dividend of $4.43 Per Share Payable December 29, 2025
signals.summary: The Monarch Cement Company declared a special dividend of $4.43 per share, payable on December 29, 2025, with an ex-date and record date of December 16, 2025. This follows a regular dividend of $0.83 per share. The announcement reflects strong financial health amid recent stock price gains.

signals.title: Monarch Cement Stock Price Rises 3.6% Following Strong Quarterly Earnings
signals.summary: Monarch Cement (OTCMKTS:MCEM) stock increased 3.6% on December 26, 2025, trading up to $235 with a market cap of $849 million. The company reported $6.44 EPS on $73.05 million revenue in its recent quarter, achieving a 19.6% net margin and P/E ratio of 15.16.

signals.title: Monarch Roofing Faces Layoffs and Management Changes After Vertex Acquisition
signals.summary: Rumors of Monarch Roofing shutting down were debunked, but the company is undergoing significant changes including removal of original management and project managers post-acquisition by Vertex Service Partners. These moves aim to streamline operations amid a slowing market. The business continues normal operations under new private equity-driven structure.

signals.title: Bay State Milling Acquires Full Ownership of Montana Gluten Free Facility
signals.summary: Bay State Milling announced on December 23, 2025, the addition of Bay State Milling Montana to its portfolio, assuming full ownership after years of partnering with Montana Gluten Free. The facility processes SowNaked Mindfully Farmed Oats, high-protein non-GMO hulless oats meeting strict gluten-free standards with lower carbon emissions. This strengthens Bay State Milling's food ingredients portfolio across 13 facilities in the U.S. and Canada.

signals.title: Bay State Milling Acquires Full Ownership of Montana Gluten Free Facility
signals.summary: Bay State Milling announced on December 23, 2025, the addition of Bay State Milling Montana to its portfolio, assuming full ownership after years of partnering with Montana Gluten Free. The facility processes SowNaked Mindfully Farmed Oats, high-protein non-GMO hulless oats meeting strict gluten-free standards with lower carbon emissions. This strengthens Bay State Milling's food ingredients portfolio across 13 facilities in the U.S. and Canada.

signals.title: Bay State Milling Assumes Full Ownership of Montana Gluten Free Facility
signals.summary: Bay State Milling announced on December 23, 2025, the addition of Bay State Milling Montana to its portfolio, taking full ownership of the facility after years of partnering with Montana Gluten Free. The acquisition strengthens their food ingredients portfolio and supports production of specialized gluten-free SowNaked oats with high protein and low gluten levels. This move expands their network to 13 milling facilities across the U.S. and Canada.

signals.title: Satake Multimix Corporation Listed in Single-use Bioprocessing Market Intelligence Report 2025-2030
signals.summary: Satake Multimix Corporation is featured among key players in the Single-use Bioprocessing Market report, highlighting rising adoption among CDMOs and CMOs. The market is driven by increased productivity, reduced cross-contamination risks, and lower capital investments compared to traditional systems. This positions Satake Multimix in a growing sector focused on biologics and biosimilars.

signals.title: Breedon Strengthens National Minimix Concrete Offering Through Acquisition of Hardcrete
signals.summary: Breedon Group announced on December 11, 2025, the acquisition of Hardcrete to enhance its Minimix concrete services across the national network. This move expands Breedon's ready-mix concrete capabilities and market presence in the construction materials sector. The acquisition supports ongoing growth in specialized concrete offerings.

signals.title: Münch Chemie International Announces Company Holidays for Christmas 2025 and New Year 2026
signals.summary: Münch Chemie International will be closed from December 24, 2025, to January 6, 2026. Orders received by December 5, 2025, will be delivered by December 19, 2025, with normal operations resuming on January 7, 2026. The company wishes customers a restful holiday season.

signals.title: Milltek End of Year Flash Sale Announced
signals.summary: Milltek Sport launched an end-of-year flash sale on December 24, 2025, encouraging customers to purchase before 2026 price increases. This promotional event highlights ongoing business activity amid year-end growth. It reflects positive momentum following product launches and motorsport involvement.

signals.title: Life at Milltek 2025 Highlights Growth and Product Launch
signals.summary: Milltek reported 2025 as a year of significant growth, including the launch of the Milltek Design range. Milltek Corp also secured its space within the industry. These developments underscore expansion in product offerings and market positioning.

signals.title: Milltek Active in Motorsport Events Across UK and Europe in 2025
signals.summary: Milltek participated in multiple motorsport events in 2025, spanning circuit racing, rally, and drifting in the UK and Europe. This involvement boosts brand visibility in the performance sector. It aligns with their expertise in exhaust systems.

signals.title: AGI Closes $85 Million Public Offering of Senior Subordinated Unsecured Debentures
signals.summary: Ag Growth International Inc. (AGI), owner of Milltec, closed an $85 million public offering of debentures on June 9, 2025. Proceeds will repay credit lines and support general corporate purposes, potentially benefiting Milltec operations. An over-allotment option for additional $12.75 million was granted.

signals.title: NORD Scales Up Production to Meet Growing Demand for Electronic Control Products
signals.summary: NORD DRIVESYSTEMS is expanding production capacities at its Aurich facility in Germany with a new building to address increasing demand for electronic control products. The project, which began in 2024, reached a topping-out ceremony in August 2025 and completed foundation work in December 2025. This expansion underscores NORD's commitment to short delivery times and global customer needs.

signals.title: NORD DRIVESYSTEMS Equips Drive Components with QR Codes
signals.summary: NORD DRIVESYSTEMS has introduced QR codes on its drive components to enhance accessibility and support. This update, announced on December 19, 2025, improves user experience for maintenance and information retrieval.

signals.title: Drive Electronics from NORD DRIVESYSTEMS
signals.summary: NORD Gear (UK) Ltd highlighted NORD DRIVESYSTEMS' drive electronics on December 16, 2025, emphasizing their role in complete drive systems since the 1980s. The announcement positions NORD as a comprehensive system provider beyond just power.

signals.title: ALDI Recalls Nature's Nectar 100% Apple Juice Due to Potential Elevated Levels of Inorganic Arsenic
signals.summary: ALDI issued a recall notice on December 22, 2025, for Nature's Nectar 100% Apple Juice over concerns of elevated inorganic arsenic levels, referencing an earlier expanded recall from Refresco Beverages US Inc. This follows a September 2024 recall expansion that included Nature's Nectar products sold in multiple states. Consumers are advised to discard or return the affected products.

signals.title: Nectar Lifescience Hits Lower Circuit Amid Heavy Selling Pressure
signals.summary: On December 24, 2025, Nectar Lifescience's stock hit its lower circuit at ₹21.14, reflecting a 4.99% daily loss amid heavy selling and surged delivery volume on December 23. The decline contrasts with minor sector and market gains, indicating company-specific negative investor sentiment and supply-demand imbalance.

signals.title: Neogen Chemicals Closes Trading Window Ahead of December Quarter Results
signals.summary: Neogen Chemicals will close its trading window starting January 1, 2026, to prevent insider trading ahead of its December 2025 quarter results. This is a standard compliance measure in preparation for earnings disclosure.

signals.title: Neogen To Participate in Upcoming Investor Conferences
signals.summary: Neogen Corporation will participate in the CJS Securities 26th Annual New Ideas for the New Year conference virtually on January 14, 2026, and the 44th Annual J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference, where CEO Mike Nassif will present at 5:15 PM Pacific time. Live webcasts will be available on Neogen's Investor Relations webpage.

signals.title: Neogen Announces Second-Quarter Earnings Release Date
signals.summary: Neogen Corporation will release its second-quarter earnings before market open on January 8, 2026, followed by a webcast and conference call at 8:00 a.m. Eastern time with executives discussing results. Replays will be available on the Investor Relations website.

signals.title: Shareholders Foundation Announces Pending Lawsuit for Neogen Corporation Investors
signals.summary: A lawsuit is pending against Neogen Corporation for investors who purchased shares prior to January 2023, alleging misrepresentations about the 3M integration process and its negative financial impacts. The Shareholders Foundation is contacting affected investors for options.

signals.title: Neogen Announces Second-Quarter Earnings Release Date
signals.summary: Neogen Corporation (NASDAQ: NEOG) will issue its second-quarter earnings release before the market opens on January 8, 2026. Executives will host a webcast and conference call at 8:00 a.m. Eastern time to discuss the results. A replay will be available on the Investor Relations website.

signals.title: Shareholders Foundation Announces Pending Lawsuit for Neogen Corporation Investors
signals.summary: The Shareholders Foundation notified investors who lost money on Neogen (NASDAQ: NEOG) shares to contact them regarding a pending lawsuit. The suit, filed on July 18, 2025, alleges securities law violations related to misrepresentations about the 3M integration and its negative financial impact. It targets investors who purchased shares prior to January 2023.

signals.title: Neogen To Participate in Upcoming Investor Conferences
signals.summary: Neogen announced its participation in upcoming investor conferences on December 17, 2025. This follows their recent earnings release date announcement and indicates ongoing investor engagement efforts.

signals.title: Nick's Expands US Presence with Aggressive Marketing and Kardashian Partnership
signals.summary: Nick's, a Swedish better-for-you snacking brand, is ramping up its US expansion for ice cream and bars through a more aggressive marketing plan, highlighted by a partnership with the Kardashians. The products use natural sweeteners like stevia and monk fruit for lower calories and sugar. The company emphasizes superior taste and science-based innovation to stand out in the health-focused market.[1]

signals.title: Nordstrong Equipment Acquires New AST Flight Former, Doubling Capacity and Expanding Offerings
signals.summary: Nordstrong Equipment Ltd. has significantly boosted its manufacturing capacity by purchasing a new AST Flight Former machine, enabling production of sectional flights from 4-48 inches (up to 96 inches) with improved precision and reduced lead times. The upgrade enhances operator safety through horizontal forming and overhead crane use, eliminating repetitive strain risks. This investment positions Nordstrong for growth in bulk material-handling equipment like conveyors.

signals.title: Nordstrong Equipment Acquires New AST Flight Former, Doubling Capacity and Expanding Offerings
signals.summary: Nordstrong Equipment has significantly boosted its production capacity by purchasing a new AST Flight Former machine, enabling them to produce sectional flights from 4-48 inches in diameter (up to 96 inches optionally) with greater precision. The upgrade reduces lead times, improves assembly speed, and enhances operator safety through horizontal forming and overhead crane use. This investment positions Nordstrong for growth in manufacturing conveyors and bulk material-handling equipment.

signals.title: Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern File STB Merger Application to Create America’s First Transcontinental Railroad
signals.summary: Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern filed a comprehensive application with the Surface Transportation Board on December 19, 2025, seeking approval for their merger to form the first transcontinental railroad. The 7,000-page filing details enhancements to competition, public benefits, and includes 2,000 letters of support, promising to retain all union jobs and create 900 net new ones. The merger anticipates $133 million in annual capital synergies and converting 2 million truckloads to rail annually.

signals.title: Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern Announce Analyst Call to Review Upcoming STB Merger Application
signals.summary: On December 18, 2025, Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern announced a conference call and webcast to discuss their STB merger application filing scheduled for December 19. The call highlights how the combination will enhance competition, deliver public benefits, and strengthen the economy while protecting union jobs. Management teams from both companies will co-host the event at 8:45 a.m. ET.

signals.title: Industrial Commission Announces Planned Retirement of North Dakota Mill President and CEO Vance Taylor
signals.summary: The North Dakota Industrial Commission announced that Vance Taylor, President and CEO of North Dakota Mill and Elevator, plans to retire on July 3, 2026, after over 25 years in the role, the longest-serving in the mill's 103-year history. Under his leadership, the mill innovated, expanded to become the largest single-site mill in the U.S., and generated record profits while supporting state farmers. A nationwide search for a successor is underway.

signals.title: North Dakota Mill CEO Vance Taylor to Retire After 25 Years of Record-Setting Leadership
signals.summary: North Dakota Mill President and CEO Vance Taylor will retire on July 3, 2026, following 25 years marked by innovation, facility upgrades, expanded product lines, and record profits. The Industrial Commission praised his contributions to positioning the state-owned mill as a key supplier domestically and internationally. Officials aim to select a successor ahead of his departure for a smooth transition.

signals.title: North Dakota Mill Reports Record Profits of Over $26.6 Million for Fiscal Year 2025
signals.summary: The North Dakota Mill and Elevator reported record profits exceeding $26.6 million for fiscal year 2025, a nearly 30% increase from the previous year. The mill achieved record shipment volumes of 18.7 million hundredweight and purchased 40.3 million bushels of grain, with gross sales of $476 million. Over half of the profits, more than $12.6 million, were transferred to the state's general fund.

signals.title: Industrial Commission Announces Planned Retirement of North Dakota Mill President and CEO Vance Taylor
signals.summary: Vance Taylor, President and CEO of the North Dakota Mill and Elevator for over 25 years, plans to retire on July 3, 2026. Under his leadership, the mill became the largest single-site mill in the country, innovated, expanded, and generated record profits while supporting North Dakota farmers. The Industrial Commission will conduct a nationwide search for his successor.

signals.title: Obial Launches High-Tech Licensed Warehousing Facility in Samsun, Türkiye
signals.summary: Obial has launched a new high-tech licensed warehousing facility in Samsun, Türkiye, featuring 12 DT-1822 flat-bottom silos designed for high durability and safe grain storage. This development enhances their storage capabilities with advanced technology.

signals.title: Altuntaş OBIAL Partners with MAX Infrastructure on Khulna Steel Silo Complex in Bangladesh
signals.summary: Altuntaş OBIAL collaborated with MAX Infrastructure Ltd. on the construction of a state-of-the-art steel silo complex in Khulna, Bangladesh, capable of storing 76,200 metric tons of wheat across six silos. The project, funded by the Government of Bangladesh and the World Bank, strengthens grain resilience and food security in the region.

signals.title: OCI Global Agrees to Sell Ammonia Distribution and Terminal Business to AGROFERT for EUR 290 Million
signals.summary: OCI Global has agreed to sell its ammonia import, distribution, and terminal business to AGROFERT for EUR 290 million, with the transaction signed on November 23, 2025, and expected to close in H1 2026 pending regulatory approvals and shareholder approval. This divestment is part of OCI's ongoing strategic review and portfolio optimization. The deal includes OCI's European ammonia terminal in Rotterdam and related distribution operations.

signals.title: OCI Global and Orascom Construction Announce Agreement to Merge into Abu Dhabi-Based Infrastructure Platform
signals.summary: OCI Global and Orascom Construction have reached an agreement to combine businesses, creating a scalable infrastructure and investment platform anchored in Abu Dhabi with enhanced global reach and diversification. The merger, announced on December 9, 2025, is subject to shareholder and regulatory approvals, with Nassef Sawiris to serve as Non-Executive Chairman. OCI's CEO highlighted it as a pivotal step in unlocking long-term shareholder value following USD 11.6 billion in strategic proceeds.

signals.title: OCI Global Reports Q3 2025 Trading Update with Declining Nitrogen Sales but Strong Shareholder Distributions
signals.summary: OCI's European Nitrogen segment experienced a 24% sales volume decrease in Q3 2025 due to planned maintenance and outages, though higher pricing provided some offset; improved results are expected in H2 2025. The company distributed USD 700 million to shareholders in September 2025, totaling about USD 7 billion since 2022. Updates also covered the Beaumont New Ammonia project nearing completion at USD 1.7 billion cost.

signals.title: Dutch Shareholder Association VEB Joins Protest Against OCI-Orascom Merger
signals.summary: Dutch shareholder association VEB has threatened legal action against OCI if it proceeds with the planned merger with Orascom Construction. This adds to opposition against the deal announced in early December 2025.

signals.title: OCI Global Settles Methanex Deal with No Material Financial Impact
signals.summary: On December 1, 2025, Methanex and OCI signed a final agreement to settle their prior deal in full, resulting in no material financial impact to OCI.

signals.title: Omas Industries Announces Expansion into UK and Northern Europe
signals.summary: Omas Industries is launching 'Omas Northern Europe' to enter the UK and Northern Europe markets amid significant growth and increasing orders. Peter Marriott, with over 30 years of experience, will lead the new company as part of an ambitious hiring plan. The expansion focuses on innovative milling solutions emphasizing automation, digitalization, energy efficiency, and sustainability to modernize the industry.

signals.title: Office Properties Income Trust Provides Update on Asset Sales and Redemption of Remaining 2025 Senior Notes
signals.summary: Office Properties Income Trust (OPI) sold 17 properties for $114.5 million during Q4 2024 and is under agreement to sell six more for $54.8 million. The company also announced the early redemption of its $113.1 million 4.50% Senior Notes due 2025, expected on January 22, 2025, funded by cash on hand. These actions aim to streamline its portfolio and manage debt obligations.

signals.title: OPI Affiliate OPI WF Holding LLC Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy Protection
signals.summary: An affiliate of Office Properties Income Trust (OPI), OPI WF Holding LLC, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on October 31, 2025, amid financial strain and a challenging office market. OPI entered a Restructuring Support Agreement to convert $1 billion of senior secured notes into equity and secured $125 million in debtor-in-possession financing. This follows a Q2 2025 net loss of $41.2 million and aims to reduce leverage and improve liquidity.

signals.title: Office Properties Income Trust Closes Private Exchange Relating to 2025 Debt Maturities
signals.summary: Office Properties Income Trust completed a private exchange of its 2025 debt maturities on December 11, 2024. This transaction is part of ongoing efforts to manage upcoming debt obligations and restructure its capital stack.

signals.title: OPI Creditors Start Confidential Talks as Debt Wall Nears
signals.summary: Creditors of Office Properties Income Trust (OPI) have initiated confidential discussions ahead of the REIT's $900 million+ debt maturity wall. Groups holding secured bonds due 2027 and 2029 have engaged advisors like Evercore, Houlihan Lokey, and law firms to negotiate restructuring terms.

signals.title: Office Properties Income Trust Enters into Restructuring Support Agreement with Noteholders
signals.summary: Office Properties Income Trust signed a Restructuring Support Agreement with noteholders to reduce debt and strengthen its balance sheet. This agreement supports the ongoing Chapter 11 process for its affiliate and broader financial restructuring efforts.

signals.title: Optex Systems Reports 21.6% Revenue Growth in Fiscal Year 2025
signals.summary: Optex Systems Holdings, Inc. announced a 21.6% increase in annual revenue to $41.3 million for the fiscal year ended September 28, 2025, driven by strong defense demand. The company secured $36.2 million in new orders but noted potential impacts from U.S. government funding delays. Stock performance showed a 108.6% year-to-date return.[1][2]

signals.title: CEO Danny Schoening Resigns; Chad George Appointed as New CEO
signals.summary: CEO Danny Schoening resigned effective December 20, 2025, but will remain Chairman of the Board. President Chad George, with extensive defense experience from Leonardo DRS and Raytheon, assumes the CEO role. This leadership transition supports ongoing strategic expansion.[1][2]

signals.title: Optex Systems Awarded $2.33 Million Contract for Optical Sub-Assemblies
signals.summary: Optex Systems received a $2.33 million order for optical sub-assemblies, with deliveries scheduled from April through December 2026 for a long-term commercial customer. The contract supports assembly of various optical units. Company expressed excitement about the opportunity.[1][5]

signals.title: Peregrine Energy Solutions, Wärtsilä, and WHC Energy Services Advance 250-MW/500-MWh Mallard Energy Storage Project in Texas
signals.summary: Peregrine Energy Solutions, in partnership with Wärtsilä and WHC Energy Services, announced on December 17 progress on the 250-MW/500-MWh Mallard Energy Storage project near Dallas, Texas, with a tolling agreement secured with a Fortune 500 company. Construction is underway, utilizing Wärtsilä’s Quantum2 technology, with commercial operation expected by year-end 2026. WHC is providing construction services, highlighting their role in innovative energy solutions.

signals.title: Dana Closes Sale of European Fluid Products Hose and Tubing Operations to Orhan Holding, A.S.
signals.summary: Dana Incorporated has finalized the sale of its European fluid products hose and tubing operations to Orhan Holding, A.S. This transaction completes a previously announced deal, strengthening Orhan Holding's position in the automotive aftermarket sector.

signals.title: Ard Zweep Appointed as New Managing Director of Ottevanger Milling Engineers
signals.summary: Ottevanger Milling Engineers has announced the appointment of Ard Zweep as its new Managing Director. Zweep brings extensive international experience from companies like Forbo, Marel, JBT, and Hotraco. Leadership expressed confidence in his ability to drive innovation, customer focus, and sustainable growth.[1][2]

signals.title: Pepco Group Releases Strong FY25 Preliminary Results with Revenue Growth and Upgraded Guidance
signals.summary: Pepco Group reported preliminary results for the 12 months ended 30 September 2025, showing revenue of approximately £3.9bn, underlying EBITDA growth of 10.3% to €865m, and net earnings up 19.7% to €219m. The company highlighted strategic progress including the sale of Poundland, exit from FMCG, and plans for digital launch in Q1 2026, while upgrading mid-term guidance and increasing dividends by 55%.[1][2][3]

signals.title: Pepco Group Announces Continued Share Buyback Programme for 15-19 December 2025
signals.summary: Pepco Group executed its share buyback programme, acquiring shares between 15 and 19 December 2025, as part of ongoing efforts to return capital to shareholders. This follows over €75m in repurchases earlier in the year and a new €50m tranche started in October 2025.[1][4]

signals.title: Pepco Group Hosts FY25 Preliminary Results Conference Call on 17 December 2025
signals.summary: Pepco Group held a conference call for analysts and investors on 17 December 2025 to discuss its FY25 preliminary results, including strategic updates and financial performance.[2][5]

signals.title: Poundland to Use Emergency Overdraft from Former Owner Pepco Amid Christmas Trading Slump
signals.summary: Poundland, recently sold by Pepco, plans to draw on a £30m overdraft provided by Pepco due to weak Christmas trading. This highlights post-sale financial support from Pepco to its former subsidiary.[6]

signals.title: Duravant Acquires PPM Technologies
signals.summary: Duravant LLC has acquired PPM Technologies from Stonehenge Partners, expanding its food processing solutions portfolio. PPM, a manufacturer of conveying, coating, and thermal equipment, complements Duravant's existing products, particularly Key Technology. Executives express excitement about growth opportunities, innovation, and market expansion.

signals.title: PPM Technologies Debuts Third-Generation FlavorWright All-in-One Seasoning System
signals.summary: PPM Technologies introduces the Gen 3 FlavorWright All-in-One seasoning system, featuring enhanced drum magnets, optional stainless-steel drum, programmable alarms, and improved safety features. The compact system combines liquid and dry seasoning for snacks, nuts, and more, with updates based on processor feedback to boost efficiency and capacity. It supports small to medium production and R&D needs.

signals.title: PPM Technologies Introduces FlavorWright SmartSpray Food Coating System
signals.summary: PPM Technologies launches the FlavorWright SmartSpray food coating system, including a durable mobile cart with integrated chemical handling and CIP spray header. Designed for efficient coating applications in food processing.

signals.title: PPM Technologies Introduces Gen 3 FlavorWright All-in-One Seasoning System
signals.summary: PPM Technologies, a member of Duravant's Food Sorting and Handling Group, launched the third generation of its FlavorWright All-in-One seasoning system on December 9, 2025. This compact, portable unit combines liquid and dry seasoning for snacks, nuts, and other foods, featuring enhanced drum magnets, optional stainless-steel drums, and improvements for safety, flexibility, and capacity.

signals.title: PPM Technologies Debuts Third-Generation FlavorWright All-in-One Seasoning System
signals.summary: PPM Technologies announced the debut of its Gen 3 FlavorWright All-in-One seasoning system, as reported on December 12, 2025. The system offers advancements in operator safety, application flexibility, and production capacity for various food products.

signals.title: PPM Technologies Introduces New Seasoning System
signals.summary: Food in Canada reported on December 10, 2025, that PPM Technologies introduced a new seasoning system for confectionery, fruit, vegetables, and other products. The announcement highlights equipment innovations in food processing.

signals.title: Perimeter Solutions Announces Agreement to Acquire Medical Manufacturing Technologies for $685 Million
signals.summary: Perimeter Solutions, Inc. (PRM) entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Medical Manufacturing Technologies LLC (MMT) from Arcline Investment Management for approximately $685 million in cash. The acquisition adds MMT's machinery and consumables business, expected to generate $140 million in revenues and $50 million in adjusted EBITDA in 2025, and is set to close in Q1 2026. CEO Haitham Khouri highlighted MMT as an excellent strategic fit with strong growth potential.

signals.title: Perimeter Solutions Prices $550 Million Senior Secured Notes to Fund MMT Acquisition
signals.summary: Perimeter Solutions' subsidiary priced $550 million in 6.250% senior secured notes due 2034 to finance the $685 million acquisition of Medical Manufacturing Technologies LLC, supplemented by cash on hand. The offering is expected to close on January 2, 2026, subject to conditions, with redemption required if the acquisition fails by September 2026. Post-transaction, the company anticipates a net leverage ratio of about 2.7x.

signals.title: Perimeter Solutions Announces Proposed Offering of $550 Million Senior Secured Notes
signals.summary: Perimeter Solutions announced plans for its subsidiary to offer $550 million in senior secured notes due 2034, subject to market conditions. The proceeds, along with cash on hand, will fund the previously announced acquisition of Medical Manufacturing Technologies LLC and related expenses. This supports the strategic expansion into medical device manufacturing.

signals.title: T&G's Apples Business Reports 29% Higher Returns for Pacific Rose in 2025
signals.summary: T&G's Apples business announced increased grower returns for 2025, with Pacific Rose leading individual variety performance at 29% up on 2024 levels. Fuji followed with 27% growth. This reflects overall momentum in their commercial apple operations.

signals.title: One Person Dies in Panhandle Milling Explosion at Dawn, Texas Facility
signals.summary: An early morning explosion on July 23, 2025, at Panhandle Milling's flour milling facility in Dawn, Texas, resulted in one fatality and three injuries, with a building partially collapsing. The company expressed deep sadness, confirmed cooperation with investigators, and CEO Bryan Ledgerwood offered condolences. Emergency responders from multiple departments assisted, and the victim was identified as 36-year-old Melissa Mungia.[1][2]

signals.title: OSHA Investigates Flour Mill Explosion at Panhandle Milling, Grain Dust Suspected
signals.summary: OSHA is probing the July 23, 2025, explosion at Panhandle Milling in Dawn, Texas, which killed one worker and injured three others, with grain dust suspected as the cause by the Hereford Fire Marshal. Structural engineers cleared the site for inspectors after the partial building collapse. The deceased worker's funeral was held on July 29.[3]

signals.title: Paterson Grain LLC Wins Bid on Hansen-Mueller Assets in Bankruptcy Auction
signals.summary: Paterson Grain LLC, a North Dakota-based subsidiary of Paterson Grain, was selected as the successful bidder on a Hansen-Mueller facility lease, oats and barley, and related forward contracts in Toledo, Ohio, during a Chapter 11 bankruptcy auction. The final approval for sales of 27 asset lots, including those won by Paterson Grain, is set for a U.S. Bankruptcy Court hearing on December 22, 2025. This acquisition occurs amid Hansen-Mueller's bankruptcy filing in November 2025 after failing to pay farmers for grain deliveries.[3]

signals.title: Peacock Announces Holiday Exclusive NFL Week 17 Primetime Game on December 27, 2025
signals.summary: Peacock will exclusively stream a primetime NFL Week 17 game live on Saturday, December 27, 2025, as part of its holiday programming. This marks the fourth exclusive NFL game on the platform this season, highlighting Peacock's growing role in NFL broadcasts amid playoff races. The announcement underscores continued partnership between NBCUniversal and the NFL.

signals.title: The Copenhagen Test Season 1 Premieres on Peacock December 27, 2025
